13.content:
[Starting weight: 125 lbs/8.13 stone]

Laurence stared obliquely in the direction of his squabbling Privy Council, his gaze met the eyes of the aging Archbishop Richelieu d'Anjou who was explaining about the buildup of forces on the Mercian border. Richelieu sat in the centre of the semi-circle table facing the throne, Laurance was the third King he'd served, the respect he inspired at court had kept the council from pulling the country into civil war when Laurence was an infant. Now at aged 21 it was supposed to be Laurence's responsibility, though he still felt as uncomfortable and unready for the throne that had been his for nearly 20 years, his lanky body and boyish features made it appear as a child was still sitting on the throne, it didn't help that whenever Laurence felt doubt he unavoidably looked at his 18 year old cousin, Charles Duke d'Lyon. 'Charlie' was ruggedly handsome and athletic, he was also ambitious and charismatic, all the traits one would expect in a King, Laurence couldn't help but feel inadequate in comparison.

"We've more than enough forces at the border to engage, with scouts reporting a two to one advantage in our favour it would be foolish to wait" one voice argued.

"Exactly" Charlie agreed slamming his fist down onto the table, "we ought to take the offensive whilst we maintain the advantage. It's time we finally drove that shewolf from her throne!"

"Be calm your grace" Richelieu requested, in his firm but quietly spoken way. Charlie hated Queen Mary of Mercia like no other, to the extent he refused to even call her by name.

"You can't seriously support depriving Queen Mary of her throne Eminence" Laurance spoke quietly, he shivered as the words left his mouth.

"It would be foolish to propose a full scale invasion in such a short time frame" Richelieu replied, skillfully avoiding the question.

"Peace surely is the best option.." Laurence demanded.

Other than a few murmurs and grunts of discontent the council remained silent, that alone was indicative of their support of Laurence's demand.

Laurence rose to his feet and turned to Richelieu, "Eminence?" he asked before turning again to face his cousin in in exasperation. "Cousin...?"

"Peace isn't an option, let alone the best." Charlie declared venomously.

"I recommend we let cooler heads prevail, once we understand Mercia's response to our actions" Richelieu at last said his is ever calm voice.

Laurence wasn't happy, he slouched back into the throne in frustration.

"Agreed?" Richelieu turned his head around the room looking at the other members of the council, "Then I suggest we adjourn todays meeting."

Laurence remained seated as the members filed out, it went badly, but not different to usual. They still behaved as if they were the regency council, rather than advisory council, and in a real sense they were. Laurence knew this couldn't continue, at some point another would likely try to take his throne and force him to abdicate - the most visible and obvious was his own cousin, Charles Duke d'Lyon.

After a few minutes of despondent sulking in the empty council chambers, he once again stood as he decided he would....
13.title: Laurence, King of Aquitaine

131.content:
Laurence headed to the Royal Lounge and took a seat in an armchair facing the window as he awaited his Page bringing his uncle. After about 10 he turned to hear the door open, his Page opened the door to let his uncle in, and then closed it behind him as he waited outside to assure they weren't disturbed. "Uncle!" Laurence smiled.

"Your Majesty" His uncle Cosimo, said as his bow sweepingly.

"Please take a seat" Laurance gestured to the sofa in front of him.

Cosimo was Laurence's mother's twin-brother, though unlike his twin-sister, Cosimo still had a thick Florentine accent. Their elder brother was the current Prince of Florentine, and the marriage had gained much wealth to fund Laurence's fathers war campaigns. "Have you come straight from council?" Cosimo asked.

"Yes" Laurance said cheerlessly, "they are almost in unanimous agreement that peace is not an option. Many, especially my cousin, want war at any cost."

"War would be very dangerous, Aquitaine may possess more men, but they are well aware of the instability here... and if threatened would use it to their advantage. In a worse case scenario their agents could assassinate key peacemakers in your council and force the country into civil war."

"Some members.... don't need such foreign help to facilitate civil war" Laurance agreed.

"The throne is yours dear Laurence" he said caringly, patting Lawrence's hand.

"It's been mine for 20 years, the Lords of the Council can't get use to not having a regency council."

"They must be forced to get use to it your Majesty... the Privy Council still acts as a regency council despite the fact it expired over 2 months ago. You must take strong action to retain your throne and to prevent civil war. You are King and the decisions rest with you as the council must respect."

"But how... how can I force them to listen"

"You're late father frequently removed members who disrespected his authority, I see that as your own solution."

"Regardless the council doesn't like my policy. I realise must listen to advice, but they advise the same whatever the situation."

"What would your policy be?"

"Peace. Castile could fall into hell at any moment, we must not pull ourselves their two with a foolish war with Mercia - one I don't believe they want." Laurence looked at his uncle smile as he continued with great confidence , "if we allied with Mercia we could bring peace to Castile and the entire continent. The momentum is with us, we must get in the driving seat"

"It's a great and ambitious vision your majesty" Cosimo knew is was ambitious, but Aquitaine was immensely powerful and he understood more than most that Mercia didn't necessarily want war.

"Is it achievable?" he asked.

"You are King, you have the ability to achieve more than you give yourself credit for.

"The council are pushing me to marry one of the Antiquan princesses, or someone from Castile. I was better thinking a Mercian Princess - or perhaps their Queen" Laurence knew the latter was incredibly controversial, and he even had his own doubts about it's achievable.

"You wish to marry Queen Mary." Cosimo said slightly startled.

"Perhaps."

"Your cousin won't like that! I'll find out from my informants in Mercia, to gage how their Royal Family might react to such a proposition."

"Thank you uncle."

1311.content:
It was late evening, pitch black outside Laurence fidgeted anxiously on the Royal Throne as he awaited his uncles arrival, Cosimo had 'news' to tell him. The Privy Council was told it was 'family' trouble back in Florentine, and were told by Cosimo in no graceful way, that they could not be present when he informed the King. Eventually his uncle arrived, he strode quickly down the lengthy isle that lead to the raised platform that the mighty golden Throne was placed upon.

"Your Majesty" He said respectfully, following it up with a bow.

"Uncle" Laurence said cheerfully.

"We should keep this brief. Certain members of the Privy Council were offended that they aren't 'privy' to this discussion, the Dowager Queen's agents inform me that several have seeked answers from Florentine."

"Are you sure nobodies listening in?" Laurence inquired.

"I'm not sure that nobodies 'trying to', but the scale of the throne room and the thickness of the doors and walls means they'll be disappointed" he answered, "they say this is the most secure room in the nation. I think we'll be fine... for the time being."

"What is it you have to tell me"

"I have heard back from Merica, my agents have informed me that there is passage for your policy to commence. They say that Queen Mary is powerhungry, but that war would be her last choice. She favours diplomacy. We should not trust or underestimate this Queen, your Majesty, but it seems that she has her best interests at heart. They can not say how possible a Marriage alliance is to her, but one is almost certainly possible with a member of her family."

"How do we proceed?"

"We must inform the Queen that we have plans for peace and an alliance, and we must do it though unusual channels, lest it be sabotaged by a naysayer. Should it get as far as negotiations, they would prosper best if you met face to face."

"How will you inform her."

"I suggest that you get the council to agree to send an emissary, with a message of their choosing, and an emissary of your choosing. I would recommend you sent the Dowager Queen... your mother. I fear it must be a close family member, and many council members will not trust me."

"Very good uncle. We will do as you say. I meet with the Privy Council tomorrow morning. The issue of was Mercia is sure to be raised. Will you inform mother?" Laurence was barely containing his excitement, he didn't want the throne - but it was his by birthright, and he couldn't wait to get one up on the disrespectful Lords who were trying to take his power for their own gains. Cosimo once again bowed before he stepped quickly out of the throne room. After a couple of seconds Laurence stood up and headed out the side entrance which lead to his private rooms.
1311.title: A week later Cosimo has new information...

13112.content:
Laurence stepped upon each stair quietly as he made his way back to the Royal bed chamber, he couldn't wait to be out of the stuffy royal attire he was wearing, his morning attire had certainly been more whether appropriate than the overly extravagant robes he had put on to meet with foreign dignitaries. Upon arriving upstairs he noticed his two valets waiting to attend him, as he entered the room the two bowed respectfully, "Good evening your majesty" they said in unison.

"Good evening" Laurence replied with a hint of kindliness in his voice, he gestured for them to rise and start undressing him. They immediately did as were told, they were brothers, both of around Laurence age, the elder of the two carefully slipped of Laurence's various pieces of attire and passed them to his brother to put away. It didn't take long before they had stripped him right down to his underwear. Laurence always felt inhibited not being fully clothed in front of people, his two valets who had served him since they were boys, and his best friend Louis, were the only people he felt comfortable around. It was fortunate really, for when he was a child and teenager, he had no choice, tradition demanded a King be dressed and undressed by his servants, even beyond his underwear, it obviously served a practical purpose too, most of his clothes were to elaborate for one servant to put on, let alone himself.

Laurence dismissed his two valets promptly, it was a hot night, so Laurence had again opted to wear only his lower underwear, thus sleep shirtless. Despite the lack of clothing, the only item he was wearing was amazingly elaborate and ornate for such a small piece of clothing.
13112.title: Go upstairs to change before bed.

131121.content:
Laurence was up and awake early the following morning, he sat cross legged on his bed as he planned and considered for the mornings important privy council meeting. His servants had bought him a substantial breakfast about twenty minutes back, and unlike normal he had eaten all of it, he had infect ordered them to bring some sugary things for afters. He was just so nervous that he needed something to keep his mind and hands occupied on. The potential scenarios of the council meeting were becoming limitless in his head, what if they knew his real intent? Regardless of what the council thought and said, it is almost certain that his ambitious cousin would make trouble, for troubles sake if nothing more. Laurence sighed heavily, and leant back onto the headboard, as he did so he heard a gently knock on his door, before it swung open.

In came two servants with an assortment of sweets, pastries and cakes. They did as he previously requested and placed them on the bed to his left side, before leaving with the tray and crockery from his breakfast. Laurence smiled at them as they bowed politely before once again leaving to carry out their other duties.

It all looked so tasty, Laurance couldn't believe he was going to eat more - especially after already finishing a hearty breakfast. Though the young King had always had a sweet tooth, so the ordering of sweets came as a surprise to no one. Determined to try everything, he started eating the various dishes sporadically. A couple of bites of one cake, more of another, a few of squares of chocolate, all washed down with a chocolate milkshake. After about fifteen minutes he was full and could eat no more, his belly was round and bloated, he leant back on his bed and rubbed his bare stomach soothingly. It felt good to be full for once, Laurence looked to his left at leftovers of his 'desert'; he had eaten more than he'd thought, from the various pieces he'd cumulatively eaten almost half a cake, a chocolate bar and a half, and two and a half pastries. Neither this, nor his breakfast were particularly healthy, both would infact be better described as fattening and unhealthy. Not that it mattered, Laurence was incredibly skinny, weighing less than 9 stone, sadly he was also completely untoned and not in the slightest bit muscular, always a mocking point when around his well toned, athletic cousin.

But Laurance would have to forget this and get dressed for his meeting, as he slid around the discomfort of such a full and bloated belly became apparent. He caught his reflection in the mirror opposite, the roundness of his bloated stomach stood out to much on his very thin frame, he couldn't help but be surprised that he had the room inside to fit the food!
131121.title: The next morning...

1311211.content:
Laurence left his bedroom and walked slowly down the corridor to his dressing chamber, as expected his two valets were there waiting for him. As usual they had chosen clothes for him to wear, officially they were only 'recommending' to him what he should wear, in reality Laurence wore what ever they selected. First came the most inhibiting bit, the older of the two placed his hands on Laurence waste and unfastened his underwear, next the younger pulled them off from the front so that the young King was no wearing no clothes, he always felt uncomfortable when his valets took off his underwear, despite the fact they were two of the three he seldom felt inhibited around; fortunately after all their years of service they knew this, and quickly pulled on another pair.

After about ten minuets they had finished dressing Laurence's bottom half, the older valet lifted the waiting corset and placed it around Laurence's middle, personally Laurence had never seen why he need wear a corset, he was very thin anyway, the answer had always been 'it goes with the outfit', somehow it seemed pointless to argue.

"Could you breath in slightly, Your Majesty" the older valet requested.

Laurence complied, though it wasn't easy breathing in while so bloated, his corset, custom made for his small frame, was not shaped to go around his rounded stomach, if they put it on regardless it would become loose when later in the day he was less bloated.

Another 10 minuets and they'd finished his assemble, extravagant hat and all.
1311211.title: Going to get dressed...

13112111.content:
Laurence had inserted his proposition as the fourth and final item of business, knowing that it would likely cause friction and thus take up more time than any of the other items. He had waited for ages to say what he wished to say, the corset had been incredibly tight and uncomfortable until his bloated stomach had gone down.

"As you know my Lords, my mother, the Dowager Queen, is to travel to Mercia to visit her sister, nephew and nieces in the coming week" It was a good enough rouse, the dowager Queen had frequently visited family since the death of her husband, her sister is married to the Florentine Ambassador to Mercia. "I wish to send with her a royal writ, so that she may inform Mercia's Queen of our desire peace, I believe that a writ handed by the Dowager Queen of Aquitaine will create the necessary impression that we are serious about our intentions"

"We desire peace?" his cousin Charlie predictably protested. "to send such a letter would show weakness"

"It would be foolish to imply our intentions were one folded" Richelieu started, "an ultimatum would be wiser."

"What, why?" Laurence said, trying to sound annoyed. It was intended that the council would not like his intended writ, he must be seen to climb down and accept the council's will, so that would not suspect the true motive of the event.

As predicted the arguments went on for over an hour, some wanted to say one thing, others another. Laurence was regularly interrupted, and his point lost throughout the somewhat aggressive debate. Sadly it was systematic of the current governance of Aquitaine. The council had become to powerful in his youth and were reluctant to give up any of it. Though the council had agreed to sent a letter with the Dowager Queen, their letter. Two pages, and only one inclusion of the word peace. Laurence put up token resistance but in the end conceded that so long as peace was mentioned there was hope. In fact the letter would never be seen by Queen Mary, The Dowager Queen was to relay a verbal message from the mouth of King Laurence and his uncle. No doubt the Aquitaine ambassador would seek to be present during the meeting, and it wasn't clear to Laurance whether he was in cahoots with council members or not. Regardless secrecy would have to prevail, and the next part was up to Laurence's mother.

Laurence had not gone to see either his mother or uncle after the meeting, in order to lower suspicion of conspiracy this would be continue to the case until his mother left. Most contact would be public, what wasn't would be fleeting and unsuspicious. Everyone knew their parts. Laurence had gone to have lunch at his terrace balcony that overlooked the Great Palace Gardens, his Nicholas Henri, his closest friend, would hopeful be arriving any time soon.

Soon enough Nicholas arrived, he bowed formally as he entered King Laurence's presence, Nicholas Henri was Count of Blois, son of the Duke of Orléans, his family, the 'house of Orléans', were second only in rank and stature to the Royal Family. At six foot, Nicholas Henri stood about an inch taller than Laurence, his hair was jet black and his skin almost the palest of whites, the most striking of combinations. He took a seat next to Laurence overlooking the gardens.

"How'd council this morning go?" He asked.

"As argumentative as usual" Laurence grunted, "you were at sparring practice at the time, am I right?"

"Yep, not quite as aggressive as your council I'll bet" Nicholas joked.

Laurence chuckled with him before turning to notice the servants bring in lunch. They place the assortments of savoury and sweets on the table in front of them, before bowing and curtsying respectively, and leaving.

"I presume you haven't eaten lunch yet?" Laurence asked picking up a chicken leg.

"No I haven't, I'm starved!" Nicholas.

The two chatted allot over lunch as Laurence tried to put the council meeting and his plans to the back of his head for the time being. Laurence had eaten a fair amount of savery foods, meat, bread and the like, but his sweet tooth had compelled him mostly to fill up on the sweets, cakes and pastries. Laurence leant back into the cushioned sofa arm and pulled legs up and curled them slightly so he wouldn't accidently kick Nicholas. His corset had again become tight as his belly bloated and he couldn't help fiddle with the back strings to try and loosen it.

"You alight Laurence?! I know you like your sugary things, but you don't normally eat quite so much for lunch!" Nicholas asked.

"Just hungry after that stressful council meeting" Laurence said.

"Haha, I can see that" Nicholas replied, "would you like me to loosen your corset, looks like your having trouble with it"

"No it's fine" Laurence lied.

"Doesn't look fine"

Nicholas stood up and went around the back of the sofa, he put his hand on Laurence's back and tilted him forward slightly before lifting up a two of his layers and pulled the string of the corset. Instantly it felt better, though it became a little tighter once again when Nicholas retied the string. "Thanks Nich"

"My pleasure" Nicholas said as he sat to take his seat again.

Laurence looked enviously at what Nicholas was wearing, though still Aquitainley extravagant, it wasn't tightly fitted with a corset like Laurence's own apparel.

"It's about time you ate something Laurie! Your almost all skin and bones!" Nicholas said, jest was in his tone but it was still honesty. Though of a small slender build, Nicholas was quite toned and athletic due to the amount of time he spend Knight training, Laurence had seen him shirtless on many occasions and was always impressed, and sometimes even slightly enviously, at his body. Despite this almost perfect (in Laurence's eyes anyway) body, perhaps in testament to the occasion fatty meal Nicholas enjoyed, he still had a slightly flabby midsection around his belly button. Laurence wondered if that was why Nicholas didn't appear bloated now.

"What shall we do now?" Nicholas asked as he leant back into his seat.

Laurence gazed out of the window full of apprehension, he had seen his mother's coach enter the palace gates about ten minuets back. The news she brings could hold the key to peace among the three great Kingdoms.

Laurence at last heard the words "My dear son"

He rushed from the window to give his mother a hug "welcome home", she gently tugged his hand, and sat him down opposite her.

"My trip went well... better than I expected" she started.

"You've got news?" Laurence replied, excitement in his voice, he turned to his left and right to check nobody was listening in.

"The Queen was receptive, she doesn't want Aquitane soldiers marching over her boarders, any more than you want Mercian ships blockading your ports. She has sent a response to the writ with her ambassador here, it will propose any negotiation's that take place - take place face to face."

"Ah" Laurence replied, "persuading the council will be tough"

"The council will tow the line, they will discover that you sent a message of your own soon enough, that's if they don't already know. Do as your father did, and your uncle suggested. Remove any dissenters from the council. The crown and throne are your's, and the Royal Guard will always choose their King. You have the upper hand, use it." She pushed.

"Thank you mother, for everything. And I will heed your advice."

Laurence was sat in his throne ready as the members of the Privy Council trailed in, the Dowager Queen sat on the consorts chair to the right of him and the Count of Blois was waiting outside, as instructed. "My Lords, we have only one matter to discuss today. Shall we keep this brief?"

"Yes Majesty" various voices said in slight intervals.

"Queen Mary of Mercia has proposed that a delegation meet on the boarder in a month to discuss a treaty that could bring us peace"

"What?" Charlie said angrily.

"I have informed the Mercian ambassador that we accept"

"Your Majesty... we, we should have discussed this first" Richelieu said in a somewhat startled tone.

"I will lead our delegation, Queen Mary will lead the Mercian delegation. We will meet face to face" He clarified. "My mother and uncle advised me not to discuss this first with my Lords of the council for fear of you blocking it"

"Too right we should block it... peace with that shewolf bitch! You must be joking"

"This is to fast, your majesty..."

"I realise that Archbishop, that is why I think it best you take your retirement" Laurance interrupted, in a gentle voice.

Laurence wasn't surprised that the Archbisop left with minimal fuss, he suspected the Archbishop had seen the hand just before he played it... and knew that his days were numbered. A graceful exit now, rather than a humiliating one later. Charlie was to be the difficult one.

"I won't resign my post" he demanded, as he stood up he banged his fist against the table in anger.

"No you won't..." Laurence replied signalling the guards, "you are no longer welcome at court... take the Duke back to his town house where he will remain under house arrest until I say otherwise."

Laurence turned back to the rest of the council, "The Dowager Queen has agreed to take Richelieu's role as chairman, until we find a sutable replacement. And I am appoint the Count of Blois, as the Duke of Lyon's replacement." He announced.

"Your Majesty" The two said in unison as they both bowed upon Laurance entering the room.

As he crossed the room he felt his bed shorts loosen slightly, the valet must not have fixed it as he thought he had - it didn't really matter though, he would be going to bed shortly. The young King sat down, took a sip of tea and a bite of cake.

1311211112111.content:
There was a knock at the door, at first Laurence ignored it, but when it banged a second time he stood up and headed toward the door, "Yes? Who is it"

"The Count of Blois, your Majesty. Shall I grant him admittance" The doorman said from the other side of the door.

"Erm, ye.. yes.. thank you" Laurence replied, he'd completely forgotten that he'd agreed to meet up with Nicholas Henri this evening. After about 30 seconds the doorman opened the door to let Nicholas in.

"Did you forget about me?" Nicholas asked, jest in his tone.

Laurence chuckled, "yes sorry"

"No probs, no probs" Nicholas said, "already for bed I see" he commented.

"I left the concert hall early cos I felt tired, by the time I'd taken a sip of tea I suddenly felt wide awake, great timing!" Laurence turned and headed towards his seat to sit down, as he did so his loosely tied bed-shorts slipped, he just managed to grab them in time before they fell.

"You okay?... didn't your valet dress you properly?" Nicholas asked.

"They had but it came slightly loose... could you?" Laurence hinted for Nicholas to try and do them up again.

"Sure" Nicholas knelt beside him and started fiddling with the laces that fastened the bed-shorts, he could see the problem instantly, they had been designed to fasten exactly into place, but they would have to be pulled much tighter to do this. "They seem to be a little tight".

"Can't you fasten it?" Laurence asked.

"I can, but I'll have to pull it tighter" Nicholas explained.

Laurence wondered for second, though it was pointless doing so - he'd never put on a hair by himself in his life, "Okay."

Nicholas pushed on his waste and pulled the lace, soon enough it went far enough that he could tie it correctly.

"Thanks allot" Laurence said, they were very tight, but felt better than them falling down, "What was the problem?"

"They didn't really fit you, they're a tiny bit too small" Nicholas replied as he knotted the end of the lace.

"Thanks for sorting them, I'll ask for them to be altered tomorrow"

"I can see why Laurie" Nicholas began, he prodded the side of Laurence's stomach as he stood back up "you've put on weight."

"Oh?" Laurence uttered cluelessly.

"By the look of it, your waist's certainly bigger." He added.

Laurence sat back down, he always got unnecessarily embarrassed at personal comments and didn't know what to say back to Nicholas. He was right of course, though impossible to see when dressed, while only wearing underwear it was difficult to hide. As well as his ribs being far less viable, his stomach felt and looked far softer, and his belly button appeared somewhat deeper as the flab had grown around it.

"You needed to add something to the bone... shame its all meat and no muscle" Nicholas reasoned.

"I don't really have time to work out" Laurence lied half heartedly.

"You should come martial arts training, or fencing" Nicholas suggested, "your eating when you feel stressed"

"I guess so" Laurence agreed.

"And I know you well enough to guess cake and sweets are what you've mainly eaten" Nicholas chuckled.

"Haha, not a surprise that I like cake?" Laurence said sarcastically as he took the final bite of his slice of cake.

"That's what's giving you your podgy belly!" Nicholas jested, pointing towards the empty plate.

"Do you think I've gained much?" Laurence asked seriously, he placed his hand on his stomach and rubbed at the soft flab self consciously.

"No idea, a only a couple of pounds perhaps... enough that it's viable when you dress like that"
1311211112111.title: A knock on the door...

13112111121111.content:
"I really ought to have my self weighed" Laurence asked, "would you help me Nic so I don't have to my physician?.... there are scales in my dressing room."

"Yes.. of course Laurie" Nicholas answered kindly.

The two went through to Laurence's dressing chamber "thanks", Laurence said as they got to the scale, he didn't have to undress as was already wearing only underwear. He stepped on apprehensively.

"Do you remember when you were last weighed, and the result" Nicholas asked as he kept an eye on the needle waiting to settle.

"I was about 125 about a month or so ago at my last medical" Laurence remembered.

"Whoa... 134" Nicholas said in slight surprise, by the look of Laurence's face he was better humoured than Nicholas expected, he patted Laurence's stomach as he helped him down from the scales, "that's nine pounds of fat on your belly".

"I ought to cut down on the sugary snacks" Laurence admitted,

"All right If I see how much I weigh whilst we're here Laurie?" Nicholas asked.

"Sure, need help undressing?" Laurence offered.

"Cheers."

What Nicholas was wearing was far simpler than Laurence usual outfits, and he stripped down to his underwear in a matter of minuets. Laurence loved seeing Nicholas shirtless, he found his bare body really attractive and sexy, though he'd never utter those words to anyone - least of all Nicholas. Though he was about only an inch or so taller than Laurence he was slender, slightly toned and quite athletic, though not to the point where he was overly muscled, in fact he himself had a quite flabby belly despite his frequent martial exercise - he guessed because Nicholas loved the odd sugary or fatty meal.

"Ready?" Nicholas asked, Laurence didn't reply so he nudged him "Laurie?.."

"Oh, yeah yeah." Laurence said taking his mind of Nicholas' body. Nicholas stepped onto the scale and waited for Laurence to let him know the needle had settled. "150 pounds"

"Okay, cool" Nicholas said as he stepped down off the scale, they gathered up his clothes and went back into Laurence's more comfortable bedchamber.

"How much more is that from last time?" Laurence asked.

"Only two pounds... from about 4 weeks back"

"Your fine, and sexy" Laurence said quietly, he'd accentually trailed into what I was thinking.

"I am?" Nicholas smiled.

"Err yes... no wonder your so popular with the ladies" Laurence explained trying to cover up his previous comment.

"Thank you" he replied graciously, "as are you"

Laurence smiled shyly, "you've still got your fair share of flab on your belly" he teased trying to defuse the tension.

"I know... ever since I was a child, I've never seemed to be able to get rid of it" Nicholas explained, demonstratively jiggling his stomach slightly.
13112111121111.title: Laurence suggest he weighs himself...

choices: Go and have breakfast with Nicholas.
131121111211111.content:
Laurence rubbed his eyes as he began to stir, he managed a slight glance at the window before hastily turning away at it's brightness. It was much later than he intended to get up, judging by how bright it was out he guessed it must at least be midday, perhaps later. He slid up so's he was leaning against his cushioned headboard and stretched his arms, after a moment he looked at the figure sleeping beside him. Laurence had almost forgotten that Nicholas had shared his bed rather than return to his own, they had been up chatting and playing card games until the small hours. This wasn't the first time they'd shared a bed, and like every time before they hadn't done anything - apart from sleep. That wouldn't stop the rumours though, Laurence expected servants had come in and seen them lying together and drawn a very predictable conclusion, though it didn't matter promiscuity was rife in the Aquitaine court, and the rumours were worse, some had him sleeping with men and women he'd never even met. If anything such a rumour about him and Nicholas would dispel any real belief, as people wouldn't know which rumour to believe. Laurence understood that the truth would become clear the second he tried to hush it up.

Laurence slipped casually off the bed, and walked quietly around to the other side, he perched on the bed next to where Nicholas was still sleeping and gazed at his cute face, after about thirty seconds he placed his hand on Nicholas' bare shoulder and shook him slightly. "Nich... Nich" he whispered.

After a short time trying to resist waking up, Nicholas opened his eyes and looked at his almost naked friend sitting in front of him, unlike Lorence he'd drunk quite a bit the previous night, for a time he wondered if the two had had sex, he cringed at the thought of having sex with his best friend while drunk and then forgetting about it. Then it became clear to him, he didn't remember doing anything - and besides Laurence hadn't drunk a drop of alcohol, he never did. Laurence was a virgin, the last thing Nicholas could imagine him doing is sleeping with a drunk 'guy' and then being totally comfortable with him the following day. "Morning" he at last said.

"Are you hungover?" Laurence asked dotingly.

"No, no. I'm fine", he lied, though by the look of Laurence's face he was a convincing liar.

"Okay cool" Laurence got up and peered into the dressing room so see if his valets were about, they weren't. He was reluctant to ask the doorman to request their presence, not when he was only wearing underwear and had another guy in his room, also only wearing underwear. He didn't mind the rumours so much, but he'd rather not feed them while simultaneously embarrassing himself. He headed back into his room where he could see Nicholas sat on the end of his bed drinking a glass of water. "Hey, Nich, I can't find my servants. Would you help me dress"

"What sorry" He answered before processing what Laurence was asking, "oh, yeah okay."

Laurence entered the dressing chamber and stood on the stall where he is usually dressed, "cheers!"

Nicholas entered a couple of seconds later to see Laurence stood on his dressing stall, "hmm by 'help you dress', do you actually mean 'dress you' Laurie?"

"Oh, no no. Force of habit. I'll help" Laurence stepped of his stool, he didn't know the first thing about dressing himself less about choosing what to wear, he flicked through a line of shirts and jerkins passingly, "any ideas?"

"Something simple... I'm no valet" he managed a chuckle despite his headache.

After about twenty minuets helping Laurence sift through clothes, choosing what to wear, having him change his mind, they finally agreed on a fairly simple ensemble, consisting of only stockings, a hose, a doublet and a jerkin. Laurence stood back on the stool and Nicholas set about dressing him, he pulled on the stocking's first and then followed it up the hose over the top, as they got near Laurence's waist they became significantly tighter, and though, with a bit of tugging, Nicholas managed to position the hose in the right place, he was struggling to buckle them up. "When did you last wear these?" he inquired.

"Err, not sure. I don't expect it was any time recently" Laurence answered.

"Looks like you've outgrown them, your waist is to big" Nicholas pointed out, once again trying, and failing, to buckle them up.

"Oh.." Laurence said, in his dispondant tone, "what if I breathed in"

Nicholas nodded and placed his hand flat just bellow Laurence's belly button, It was clear to Nicholas that this was due to Laurence's recent weight gain, especially feeling his soft belly. Nether the less Laurence breathed in and Nicolas managed to buckle the hose up, he stepped back to pick up the doublet and looked at how tight the hose was around Laurence's waist, the way it made his belly protrude slightly over the front, back and sides, made him look much fatter than he actually was.

"That's fine thanks." Laurence said, stopping Nicholas from having to asking whether they were too tight.

After another ten minuets they were done, Nicholas was quietly pleased with his job of dressing Laurence - he didn't look at all scruffy. Though it certainly didn't want to make a habit of it. He'd dressed back in what he was wearing the previous night, with Laurence help (which wasn't that much use).
131121111211111.title: Next morning...

choices: Field of the Cloth of Gold
1311211112111111.content:
The Privy Council was meeting this morning to discuss the future peace and treaty negotiations with Mercia, without the louder dissenters it was going faster than usual - though not efficient, Laurence found it pleasurable to have his own voice heard. People voiced opposition to peace still, but without Richelieu or Cousin Charles there to lead opposition or to guide the undecided, councillors tended to speak their minds.

The Privy Council and the Mercia Privy Council had been exchanging messages for days discussing where and when the proposed negotiations were going to take place. Much to Laurence's surprise the Mercian suggestion of a temporary built palace on the border had gone down well with the council who had agreed with little argument. It had been decided that the Dowager Queen would rule as Regent for the duration of the summit, and most of the members of the Privy Council would remain to advise her. Laurence knew that leaving his mother with the reigns of power, and his best friend Nicolas Henri on the privy council meant any potential coup that he'd been warned about would be very difficult.

For the first time ever, Laurence felt content on the throne and optimistic for the future. There was every possibly the peace negotiations with Queen Mary could go badly, that disitents could attempt to disrupt them, but the fact that the summit was happening, between two monarchs was a historic achievement, it had been over half a millennia since an Aquitaine King had last met a Mercian King.

Though even if what people said about Queen Mary were only the slightest bit true, this was going to be a tough negotiation.
1311211112111111.title: The next council meeting.

13112111121111111.content:
The Aquitaine Royal procession had arrived ahead of the Mercian one, they were calling this the 'Field of the Cloth of Gold', the temporary palace structure was entirely covered in golden cloth, it was massive, he rode through the southern gatehouse which lead through to a courtyard of about a square mile, entirely surrounded by the palace, at the northern side was another gatehouse, presumably were the Mercian royal procession would enter.

The Aquitane entourage was to utilise the southern half of the palace, and the Mercians the Northern half.In the court yard was a jousting field, sparing platform, a stage for entertainment. On one side was a 'royal box' with seats in reserved for the Royal Families, Laurence couldn't help noticing two great thrones place in the centre, his excitement was almost too much to contain.

Though Laurence had been 'advised', told, that he must change before meeting with the Queen. By this he knew that it was 'dress to impress', no doubt she would be doing the same. Both monarchs and their main entourage would be wearing the most exotic and ostentatious clothing imaginable for the duration of this meeting. For while this was a negotiation for peace, it was also the centre of heightened competition.
13112111121111111.title: Field of the Cloth of Gold

131121111211111111.content:
Laurence strode into his bed-chambers proudly, the palace was magnificent truly a feat of engineering. He could scarcely believe it was only a temporary structure, through the double doors at the far end of the bed chamber was his dressing chamber, it was almost as large as his one back in the palace in the capital - the amount of clothes that were brought seemed over the top, he very much doubted he would even wear half of them.

Even Laurence knew that his travelling clothes were unsuitable for meeting with the Queen of Mercia, they were loose, comfortable and above all simple; what he was going to be wearing was likely going to be the furthest thing from all three. He re-entered his bed room just as his valets arrived from dropping their stuff off at their quarters.

"Your Majesty" They said in unison, both bowing.

"Magnificent, isn't it" Laurence said, signalling for them to rise and follow him to get changed.

"Yes your majesty, I didn't even know such a place could be built in a matter of a month." the elder valet said candidly.

Laurence stepped onto his dressing stall, the two brothers started gathering the clothes he was to wear - clearly they had decided long before he arrived what he'd be wearing when he met the foreign Queen. As usual they started by completely stripping off Laurence's clothes, the simplicity of the clothes meant the time spent doing so was pleasurably short. Unfortunately the next part wasn't so quick, by the time they got to his upper half his legs were aching, his upper half was faster, to his great relief they didn't have a second episode of struggling to tie the corset up over his belly, mind you he was bloated then. To finish the ensemble they placed a exotic head piece on his head, it was supposed to be a hat - but in truth it scarcely fitted that description.

Laurence left the room, his neck felt a little strained, his to valets accompanied him to the door before he dismissed them. Before he met with Queen Mary Laurence decided he would...
131121111211111111.title: Getting changed.

1311211112111111111.content:
As he was being dressed, Laurence had felt his stomach rumble - not least when they were putting clothes on their. He was starving, the last thing he wanted to do is embarrass himself by letting it happen again when meeting with the Queen. He placed an order with the servant that was stationed next to his door guards, and took a seat at the table next the window over looking the lake. Within a matter of minuets, two servants arrived with his lunch - considerably faster than back at the Royal Palace.

"Thank you." He said.

"Your Majesty" they said politely, as they once again curtsied, before leaving.

As ordered they had bought him a simple cheese sandwich, he thought he'd better have something savery, along with that was an assortment of cake slices, and some chocolate for afterwards, in truth with the exception of the sandwich it was far more than he'd ordered.

Though Laurence had doubted he'd eat all of it, he proved himself wrong. The nervousness that was building up inside him, and somehow the sugar made him feel somewhat more calm, though this was certainly nothing more than a placebo. Mistakenly he had eaten enough that he felt his stomach become bloated, and the corset become tight. There was nothing he could do about it, it was defiantly on well enough that it wouldn't loosen again.

----

Laurence heard a knock on the door, before he could answer it, it was opened and his Lord Chancellor walked in and bowed low, "Your majesty, as ordered I have come to take you to meet with Queen Mary of Mercia"
1311211112111111111.title: Have lunch before meeting with Queen Mary.

choices: The Queen and King make there way to the waiting courtyard...
13112111121111111111.content:
Laurence braced himself for what was beyond the threshold, from were he was standing he could see the red carpet, and the crowds of the two nation's courtiers either side. He was to enter through this entrance, Queen Mary, by one on the opposite side before they headed through to the courtyard to 'discuss' the the treaty. Laurence took a deep breath and entered the room, the daunting feeling made carpet feel endless, the trumpets played as the two monarchs entered, a different tune for each one, and heralds called out their names and titles. Behind Laurence stood his 17 year old brother Prince Joseph, and his 20 year old sister Princess Katherine, should the treaty go according to plan they would likley be involved in the marriage deals. Regardless, like Mary he had to be flanked members of his family.

From the other side walked Queen Mary, he could see two figures behind her, but his eyes could barely get passed her. She was most certainly dressed to impress, she wore a golden, purple and scarlet dress, her hair was the most elaborate hairstyle he'd seen in years, on top and around it sat a exquisite jewel encrusted headdress. She was beauty was surprising, and somewhat disconcerting. He couldn't help find himself becoming intimidated by her very presence. Behind her stood a guy and a women around his age, the guy was exquisitely dressed, fashionably so. Not so over the top as Queen Mary, or Laurence himself. The women, was dressed in a elegant scarlet dress, not dissimilar to Queen Mary's, though far simpler.

Upon reaching the centre, Laurence bowed, a second later she followed suit and curtseyed.

"Queen Mary" Laurence spoke first.

"King Laurence" Queen Mary replied a second later. She was cleverly allowing him to make the first moves, by doing this he was bowing and addressing her first - thus inserting her above him. "Allow me to introduce my brother... Prince James, Crown Prince apparent. He stepped forward and knelt in front of Laurence, as per protocol he held his hand out and the Prince kissed it. The Prince then rose, and when Laurence saw his gorgeous face, he couldn't help going weak in the knees. The Prince shot Laurence a warm look and a cheeky smile, something told Laurence that he'd noticed. The Prince then stepped backwards, retaking his place behind her. "and my cousin, Princess Margaret" the Princess step forward and bar the look, did the same as the Prince.

"May I introduce, my brother Prince Joseph" Prince Joseph stepped forward and knelt before Queen Mary and kissed her hand when she placed it in front of him. "And my sister, the Princess Katherine, Countess d'Bourbon" likewise she did as her brother, and the Mercian princes did.
13112111121111111111.title: The Queen...

choices: They agree to a marriage alliance with one another...
They sign and swear to uphold the treaty...
131121111211111111111.content:
Laurence's heart was still beating at an abnormal rate, he was still unbelievably nervous. As they headed out to the Courtyard where they were to 'discuss' the treaty, Laurence walked along side Queen Mary, Prince Joseph next to Prince James, and Princess Katherine next to Princess Margaret, all in order of precedent. As they got out side Laurence took a seat in the gilded throne with Aquitaine flags either side, facing another gilded throne with Mercian flags either side.

They were suppose to discuss the terms of the treaty, though most of this had already been carried out. This was more a formality to 'agree'. The treaty had confirmed they would both seal the deal with multiple marriage alliances, the Princes's they'd both brought were to be a to be a part of this marriage alliance. After half an hours worth of discussion they finally got around to the marriage alliances. Informally they had decided who would be marrying who, but for formality and tradition's sake the monarch must offer the Princess for marriage, rather Prince. When the marriages took place the Princess would likely reside in the country of their husband and not vice versa.

"So It is agreed" Queen Mary said, "Princess Margaret... will marry Prince Joseph."

"And Princess Katherine will marry Prince James" Laurence agreed.
131121111211111111111.title: The Queen and King make there way to the waitin...

1311211112111111111111.content:
"And..." Queen Mary added, "the marriage between you the King of Aquitaine"

"and you, the Queen of Mercia" Laurence agreed. He'd half expected the crowd to look surprise, but most had been expecting this outcome. He suspected all were weighing up the pros and cons, wondering what each party will want to gain from this marriage.

Laurence knew some of the risks, but certainly not all. He could also see all the benefits. She would become Queen Consort of Aquitaine, and he either Prince Consort or more likely King Consort of Mercia, given the fact he is already a King. Their first born child would be in line to inherit both the Kingdoms, such a unification would see the largest Empire since the days of the ancient Imperium. Should there be complications down the line, their eldest child could inherit from the first of them to die, and the second eldest could inherit the other. It was done now, only time would tell how it would work out.

After they finished negotiating they both signed the treaty and swore on the Holy Book to uphold it to the best of their ability, after that came the dancing. Laurence danced with Queen Mary for the first time, she was suprisngly talented dancer, not quite so ridged and cold as he expected. Princess Katherine and Prince James were also dancing with one another, as were Prince Joseph and Princess Margaret.
1311211112111111111111.title: They agree a marriage alliance to one another...

13112111121111111111111.content:
After the dancing the feast got under way, there was allot of food, but it was far less formal than he'd been expecting. Once people had fished eating the main course they started mingling, they drinking wine, ate deserts. It was a pleasure to see the two courts getting along so well. The difference in dress between the two courts was stark, there were allot of similarities true, both were over the top and ostentatious, but the Mercian ones seemed somewhat more sensible and graceful than the Aquitaine ones. The Mercian ones had allot of emphasis on the head garment, the Aquitaine on make up and large dresses. Laurence could see his sister chatting happily with Princess Margaret, it was good that they were getting along. Queen Mary was now mingling with senior members of Laurence's court, he was suppose to be doing the same, but it wasn't really something he was good at. His Lord Chancellor and Uncle had this in mind and were doing allot of this on his behalf, while he was taking it more easily. He had been talking with some Mercian diplomat, but was now sat down with a slice of cake, and a glass of juice.

"Your Majesty" came a voice from behind him, he turned his head and missed him as he came and sat down beside him. It was Prince James. "Might I say you have an incredibly interesting and exotic court"

Laurence smiled "You may.. and you Mercians have an incredibly interesting, and bizarre choice of hats." he chuckled so's it was clear he wasn't truing to be insulting. He was still nervous over the look he had been given earlier.

Fortunately James got that "they certainly are bizarre aren't they" James agreed.

"So, what do you think of your wife to be?" Laurence asked.

"She is very beautiful, and a great dancer" he replied. "How about your future Queen?"

"She too is very beautiful" Laurence stated.

"Do you get slightly nervous in her presence"

Laurence physically shock as he said it, "er.."

"It's okay, everybody does" James interrupted, he placed his hand reassuringly on Laurence's.
13112111121111111111111.title: The feast...

131121111211111111111111.content:
The two sat there talking for a good hour as the party continued, they had a surprising amount in things common. They liked the same sort of sports, foods and games, didn't enjoy parties as much as most courtiers, although James was clearly far more outgoing and confident than Laurence himself was, and could navigate through these court parties without looking awkward, James had even kindly gone and got Laurence a top up of juice and another slice of cake.

"That's very kind of you" Laurence said as James came back, with a glass of wine, a glass of juice and two slices of cake.

"It's my pleasure." James replied, once again taking a seat beside Laurence.

James was still in awe of James, he was seriously trying to deny to himself how attractive he found the handsome Prince, in his nervousness he ate the slice of cake far faster than he perhaps should have done and it gave him a touch of indigestion.

"Are you okay?" James asked, as Laurence went quite and started rubbing his chest.

"Yeah, I'm fine. Sorry, just a touch of indigestion" Laurence replied.

"Not bad food I hope" James said lightly.

Laurence managed a smile in response, he noticed that the party was drawing to a close, people were leaving gradually - possibly go to the Jousting which was to begin in about half an hour, as King he had to be there anyway, he kind of wished he could stay and keep talking to Prince James, but he didn't really want to embarrass himself further.

"It's been great chatting with you" James said, appearing as if he was about to get up, "perhaps we could chat some more later or... something" he left the sentence hanging."

"Huh" Laurence hesitated

"You could come by room or...." he paused again, "I could come by yours?"
131121111211111111111111.title: Continue talking to Prince James...

1311211112111111111111111.content:
"Yeah sure... that sounds like fun" Laurence replied, he wondered if he was missing something, "Probably easier if you come by mine, come through the dressing chamber"

"Be seeing you later then" James said, patting Laurence gently on the shoulder before leaving to catch up with his sister who just left in front of him.

The afternoon's entertainment was almost delightful, while he didn't enjoy the jousting so much he put on a good face for it, sat next to Queen Mary, his bride to be. The sparring tournaments were much more enjoyable to watch. Then there was the dinner feast, far more formal, Laurence sat at the head of the table next to Mary, he wasn't seated close enough to James to talk, but he was going to see him later so that didn't matter.

Mary chatted a little bit about her plans for the wedding, and coronations. Laurence could see that the location of the wedding would be one of the arguing points for later, he didn't have the will to argue against Mary now, she was an incredibly persuasive person, he was hardly surprised that she became Queen. She was a very impressive and inspiring women, and person, for Laurence knew no men of her apparent capabilities.

The choice at dinner was massive, the mix of delicacies and dishes from each countries, the wide choices of meat. Then the desert! The choices of ice cream, cakes, pastries were more expansive than he'd ever seen, ones from both sides of the border - some that he'd never tasted before. By the bite Laurence could feel his stomach get more bloated, and his corset more tight, but the food was so delicious that he couldn't stop. By the end of the meal Laurence was absolutely stuffed, he doubted he'd ever eaten so much in the whole of his life, not even in the last few stressful months, it wasn't one of those feasts that was likely to occur again for a very long time, even at other banquets such as the various weddings. This was not only celebrating the future marriage of two monarchs, but peace, a treaty, 2 other royal marriages. Evens like this rarely happened.

Fortunately chat continued for a while after every one had finished, and it allowed the bloating to go down before he again had to move.
1311211112111111111111111.title: "Yeah sure!"

choices: James arrives quietly through the dressing room...
13112111121111111111111111.content:
James was later than he'd been expecting, Laurence sat on the end of the bed waiting. Because his valets had chosen a piece of bed ware that only consisted of only underwear he was forced to wear a simple gown to cover up his chest for when James was here, he could ask them for something else, or suggested they did it later lest he rouse suspicion. They had been surprised when they'd seen how bloated Laurence's stomach was, the elder one had to kick the younger one as he almost accidently referenced it. Laurence was relived that since it had gone right down and no longer felt bloated or uncomfortable.

Laurence looked up at the door, he couldn't help but wonder how much longer James was going to be.
13112111121111111111111111.title: To bed.

131121111211111111111111111.content:
Just as he was about to give up and go to bed Laurence heard his dressing chamber door creek open, and he saw a scantly clad James enter.

"Sorry I'm late, there was a guard next to the dressing room door, I had to wait until they switched." James said calmly, perching next to Laurence on the bed.

"That's okay... now you see why I wouldn't have been able to get out unseen" Laurence explained.

Like him, James's bed clothes were of the underwear variety, he had the foresight to put on a vest though.

"So..." Laurence said awkwardly "what shall we talk about"

"Oh?..... you want to talk?" James said in slight surprise, "sure" he added kindly.

"Th.. that's what you suggested" Laurence replied nervously.

James could see how nervous Laurence was, he was so dense it was cute. "Did you not notice me flirting with you?"

"You were flirting with me" Laurence asked, shock still in his voice.

James had thought he's realised, though he knew that Laurence wasn't flirting back. They'd genuanly got on very well, but James now started to feel bad lest Laurence think he was being used.

"How. how did you?" Laurence asked nervously.

"I prefer guys" James explained, "the look you first gave me... and then when ever I looked at you all afternoon"

"It was that obvious?" Laurence replied.

"Only to me" don't worry "we don't have to do anything, we can just chat if you'd prefer"

Laurence hesitated for a second, "no, I would like too" he croaked.

James smiled kindly as he drew closer to Laurence as kissed him, it was Laurence's first proper kiss. After about seconds they stopped, and James crawled onto the bed taking Laurence's hand and guiding him to follow, as they both sat down leaning against the headboard James pulled off his vest, his chest was just as beautiful as he'd hoped, like the rest of James's slender body, his chest was flat and untoned, to Laurence's pleasure James took his hand and placed it on his chest, insinuating that he could touch, it felt softer and pudgier than Laurence had been expecting.

James reached over to Laurence's gown and pulled it off, he leaned in to kissed him and placed his hands on the sides of Laurence's belly, he'd always heard how skinny the King of Aquitaine was, he could now see where those masses of food Laurence had eaten earlier were going. Similarly James had a slender body but a slightly pudgy stomach, however Laurence's body was far thinner, but his stomach felt softer, and appeared far flabbier than his own, he couldn't stop him self from rubbing and squeezing it sensually.
131121111211111111111111111.title: James arrives quietly through the dressing room...

132.content:
Laurence was left fuming; his sense of frustration growing with every moment that passed. Council - his advisory council - never seemed to resolve anything.
