"Why am I here? What have I done?"

It was a sad sight to see, the young boy was so terrified. As he spoke Joseph could see tears rolling down his cheeks, "You've done nothing. You'll be released soon, i promise you"

He didn't look reassured, the landlord sneered.

"I..if it's money you want" he stuttered, "I can get you money. My.. my cousins the Queen, she'll pay for my freedom"

"No it's not money we want" Joseph replied calmly.

"She's paying for your freedom now?" The landlord said sarcastically, "only an hour ago you threatened that she would have our heads if she found out"

Stephan was unable to reply, he looked at the ground.

Joseph didn't appreciate the irony, "I dare say the Queen would put our heads on spikes should she found out... given your treatment of the poor boy, I hardly think she'd show you in particularly any mercy"

To Joseph's surprise, the landlord offered no retort.

"Once our operation is complete, then we'll free you" Joseph said. "In the meantime landlord, I want you to treat him sell. The Duke would not appreciate such tortuous treatment, not least because his of royal blood.
1553112.title: Stephan is being treated poorly...

15531122.content:
"Operation...?" the young Prince stuttered, his eyes were read and teary, "do.. do you plan to hurt the Queen"

Joseph looked at The Landlord scornfully, he'd said too much. He didn't know how to reply.

"You plan to kill her!" Stephan sputtered, the look between his two Aquitianeian kidnappers said just as much as words could.

"Calm yourself" Joseph replied, Stephan was struggling trying to move towards the door, after less than a step he collapsed because of his injuroues, not that he could have gotten anywhere. "Landlord.. help the Prince onto the bed."

The Landlord grunted and lifted the young boy from the floor and dropped him carelessly onto the bed.

"You can leave us now" Joseph ordered. For a second he thought the Landlord may refuse, but the look Joseph gave him must have made him change his mind. "I will be using you as a guise to gain entry into the palace." he explained as he turned to face Stephan, he shot the frightened boy a reassuring smile, though he can't imagine it made him felt much better.

"Why.. why me?" Stephan stuttered.

"Because... it is thought that I might pass as you. We are about the same age, height and body type." Joseph explained, he picked up Stephan's clothes that were hung to the side and put them on. They were traditional Mercian noble dress, expensive cloth, rich colours though not quite as extravagant as he was use to. It was a little snug around the waist, where Stephan was a fair bit thinner than Joseph but other than that it was ideal. "Not a bad likeness"

Stephan refused to respond and turned the opposite direction.
15531122.title: Joseph changes into the Earl's clothes,

choices: On the way to the Palace.
On the way to the Palace.
155311222.content:
After undressing from Stephan's clothes, Joseph set about dying his hair. A professional barber had been brought along to do it, the processing of dying took around an hour, and once it was dry the barber cut it into a style similar to Stephan's. Fortunately very little was taken off, as Joseph's hair wasn't much longer than the prince he was attempting to imitate. Once he was done he got dressed and returned to the room in which Prince Stephan was being kept.

"I look like your splitting image... wouldn't you say" Joseph said proudly.

"I suppose" Stephan replied reluctantly.

"I will assure that you are kept well" Joseph said comfortingly to Stephan, stroking his face. "and you'll be able to go home before too long."

"Your a good liar" Stephan replied solemnly, as Joseph stood up and headed for the door.

Joseph didn't know how to reply.

"J..just know that those of the Mercian Court are also adept liars.... and th..they hate Aquitaines." By now he was breathing heavily, struggling to get the words out, "if.. if the Queen should find out then... then you will crave.. th..the release of death."

Once again Joseph didn't know how to reply, Stephan neither sounded like he was threatening Joseph nor warning him, only stating facts. And as hard as he tried to reject it, he knew that Stephan's words were only too true. Rumour had it that Queen Mary was an incredibly intimidating women, a women utterly loyal to her family and country. She wasn't weak like Aqutiaine's poor excuse for a King, and despite his inflated ego aside she would eat the Duke of Lyon for breakfast. Joseph decided to say nothing, he excited the room and closed the door softly behind him, not taking another look at the unfortunate Prince they were holding prisoner.
155311222.title: Joseph dyes his hair

choices: Is taken to before the Queen.
1553112221.content:
After leaving the safe house, Joseph was whisked across the city and quietly slipped into the carriage that has supposedly carried him from his ancestral home to Mercia's capital. Joseph didn't know which of the guards or servants accompanying the convoy knew of his plans, some were Aqutiaine spies others had accompanied the convoy before it had been secretly hijacked, and thus knew nothing. Truthfully it was probably best Joseph didn't know what others knew. For the next months, or years he wasn't Joseph - he was Stephan a Prince of Merica and a member of the House or York.

As the carriage made it's way towards the palace, Joseph was impressed by it's size and grandeur. It was easily a rival of the Royal Palace back in Aqutiaine. As the carriage drew into the palace gates and stopped beside a side entrance, Joseph could see an honour guard had assembled to greet him, complete with trumpets and a red carpet.

"His Royal Highness, the Prince Stephan, Earl of Lancaster" it was announced as Joseph, in his guise as Stephan took his first steps into the Royal Palace.

The grandeur inside was easily a match of the outside, it had been years since Joseph had spent anytime in a Royal Court. His jealous lover, Duke Charlie, rarely visited the Aqutiaine court, thus neither did Joseph. It was hard not to be swept up in the magnificence of it all, Joseph had to remember that this was the nexus of the enemy. All around him were people who would gladly see the end of his country and it's ways.
1553112221.title: On the way to the Palace.

choices: Is introduced to the Montrose family.
15531122212.content:
"Your Royal Highness" a tall gaunt women said, curtseying before Joseph.

"Madam" Joseph said, in a clear Mercian accent. He followed up with a slight bow, this women was certainly of high rank. Her ornate headpiece was truly unusual, covered in lace, and diamond and perched upon her head it was almost a foot in height, it must make going through low doors a problem. The worrying thing is, he could imagine the women of Aqutiaine going for such a fashion, yes they may not have such an obsession with hats, but they've got weirder with other clothing, and hair styles - this would be right up their street, and anything to beat this royal court.

"I am the Duchess of Cleaves, I attend your cousin the Queen. She demanded your presence as soon as you were brought to court." She went on.

"Then lead the way." Joseph replied.

As Lady Cleaves lead Joseph to the throne room, he began to feel more at home when he saw the ridiculousness of some of the dresses worn by the court women, as well as the overly feminine clothes worn by some of the men. When he first caught a glance of the Queen, he was expecting her to be no different. And though she was a magnificent dress, and large headpiece she didn't look at all ridiculous, she looked powerful and intimidating. As attractive as any women he'd met before, he doubted she's be anywhere near as flirty or promiscuous.

"Your Majesty" Joseph said, kneeling before the raised throne.

"Cousin Stephan" she replied, he tone was cold yet soft. It seemed she was being as friendly as she could manage. She signaled for him to stand.

"I trust that you have had a good journey" she asked.

"Yes Ma'am, it was relaxing but pretty uneventful" he lied.

"Condolences on the death of your mother"

"I appreciate the sentiment, Ma'am."

""I'm sure that you want to get settled in, so I'll be brief, as you know I am to appoint a new guardian. The Dowager Duchess of Montrose has been chosen, she will take care of you over the following year until your adulthood, at sometime after you will marry her daughter, Lady Cecelia, who is only four years your senior."

"Yes, your Majesty" Joseph bowed his head... marriage, he thought, how would he get out of that if he was still here when he 'came of age'.

"The dowager Duchess also has a son of 15, the current Duke." she added, "you will be educated, and cared for alongside him."

Along side him, an odd choice of words considering Stephan would be considered senior to the current Duke, since he was a member of the royal family. "As you wish, Ma'am" Joseph replied, this time bowing quite low.

"Anyway, I'll see more of you at dinner I expect. I've got other business I must attend to, and I'm sure you wish to get settled in. The Duchess of Cleaves will show you to the Montrose apartments."
15531122212.title: Is taken to before the Queen.

155311222121.content:
The Duchess of Cleaves cordially lead Joseph to the apartment complex that was residence to the Montrose family, she didn't speak to him nor did she wait around once they had got there. She explained the porters would bring his lugage up before long and left, quite apruptly. The Montrose appartments were suprisingly large, Joseph entered into them via a large that made him feel as if he was in a country manner house, from just a glimpse of the three coridors he could see that there were atleast two dozen rooms, likley more. And if the hall way was anything to go buy, they would all be richly furnished. Though Joseph couldn't have expected anything less in a Royal Palace, even if it's only the appartments of a noblemen.

"Anyone here" he said loudly, Joseph had expected to be met - either by members of the Montrose family, or there servents. But the apartments seemed to be empty, it did seem the perfect time to explore... see what he can find out, but the dossier mentioned in detail how Prince Stephan was a quite boy with very good manners, exploring places that don't belong to him would be quite out of character. So it was probably prudent to remain in the hall way unti lsomeone turns up for him, Stephan was also said to be patent, something that Joseph was not.

Joseph took a seat and waited for about fiveteen minuets and finally someone turned up, a finely dressed women, Lady Cecelia perhaps? Though this women looked a little too old. "Maddam" Joseph said, standing upon the women's entry, bowing slightly.

"Your higness" she returned the respect with a curtsey, "I am the Baroness Walwich, I surve as the Dowager Duchess' cheif lady. I'm afraid, my lady is in a meeting of council at the moment. I will show you to your rooms so that you can unpack, and the Montrose family will be allong shortly"

"Thank you, my lady" Joseph replied.

Baroness Walwich showed Joseph to the room that was to be Prince Stephans'. Shortly after his lugage was brought in and placed on the floor ifront of his double poster bed. The room was double the size of his one back home at the Duke of Lyon's palace, and the furnishings were significantly nicer, more ornate. On the wall were portraits of what he presumed were Montrose noblemen of past, or Mercian hereos, as well as landscapes of the country side.

After unpacking Stephan's clothes and nicknacks, Joseph lay on the bed to have a nap as he awaited the return of the Montrose family.
155311222121.title: Is shown his apartments.

1553112221211.content:
Joseph must have been napping for about half an hour before he heard a light tapping on his door, when he opened the door the Baroness Walwich informed him that the Montrose family had just returned and that she'd take him to the lounge to meet them. Joseph was polite and appreciative and followed Lady Walwich. As they progressed towards the lounge, Joseph got a better idea just how big the apartment was, and it was even bigger than he had first guessed. Easy for most to get lost in, he imagined; fortunately Joseph had a good sense of direction, and in general could find his way even after seeing it once.

"Your Grace" Baroness Walwich curtseyed low as she lead Joseph into the lounge, "this is Prince Stephen"

"Your Royal Highness" the Dowager Duchess of Montrose, and a young women sat beside her, stood up and respectfully curtsied to Prince Stephan, obviously despite the rank of the Montrose family Stephan was still higher in the order of precedence on account of being Royalty, however distant that may be. "Please take a seat"

"Thank you your Grace" Joseph said, he took a seat opposite the Dowager Duchess, the beautiful young women sat next to her was presumably the Lady Cecelia, Stephan's future bride.

"This is my daughter, Lady Cecelia" The Duchess confirmed.

"Your Highness" Cecelia smiled at Joseph.

"Now introductions are over we will adopt a more informal style... when in private" The Duchess explained, "you may call me Lady Margaret... and we will call you only by your first name... as you will my daughter Cecelia, and son Alexander, after you've been introduced to him of course."

"Yes your Gr... Lady Margaret" Joseph was relived that they would be dropping the titles when in private, they made every situation seem so formal.

"When will I meet the Duke" Joseph asked.

She smiled kindly at Joseph, "he is at a mathematics class at the moment, he should be back in around half an hour. Both myself and my daughter have positions at court, so Alexander will be expected to show you what is what.. you will attend classes with him, and for the time being socialise with him as you would a blood brother."

"That's very kind, Lady Margaret"
1553112221211.title: The Montrose family return.

15531122212111.content:
The Duke was longer than expected, after getting a cup of tea brought for Joseph Cecelia and Lady Margaret had to leave to attend to their court duties, what ever they are. So Joseph was once again left alone in the Montrose apartments. He imagined that if the real prince Stephan was in this situation he'd be feel pretty awkward, given how quite and perhaps introverted it is said that he is. Joseph didn't have the same problem, he wouldn't be much good at his job if he did.. but he was going to have to pretend.

After another fifteen minuets of waiting, when Joseph had long finished his tea he heard a noises coming from down the hall - presumably was the front door opening and closing. 'Finally', he thought to himself. He moved across the lounge and took a seat in a sofa that faced the door, he was just seated again when the Duke came through the door.

(The duke was....)
15531122212111.title: Meeting the young Duke

choices: Alexander shows Stephan around the palace.
Alexander shows Stephan around the appartment.
155311222121112.content:
Joseph looked at the slowly opening door as the boy he assumed was the Duke of Montrose walked in.

"Your Royal Highness" the boy said, once he reached Joseph's proximity he gave a sweeping bow and removed his extravagant hat, "I am Alexander, the Duke of Montrose."

"Your Grace" Joseph stood up and bowed slightly to Alexander. Joseph was struck, the Duke was very cute... boyishly handsome. He was fairly tall, standing an inch or so above Joseph. He didn't appear to be particularly built or athletic, his arms, legs and face were quite thin, though looking at his midsection Joseph could see a undisguisedly chubby belly, shaping his slightly tight jerkin.

"It is a great honour, and I'm sure a pleasure, to have a Prince of the great house of York as a brother and friend" Alexander marveled as he took a seat on the opposite Joseph.

"It's a great honour to be welcomed to cordially to your house"

Alexander chuckled, "this is your family's palace... Mother says that I am to show you around.. tell you what's what."

"I'd appreciate it" Joseph replied.

"Call me Alexander... Alex, by the way" Alexander told Stephan, his smile was so warm and friendly, Joseph couldn't help but genuinely smile back.

"And you call me Stephan"
155311222121112.title: a slightly podgy boy.

choices: Continue the tour of the palace.
1553112221211121.content:
"Come, I'll show you around the palace" Alexander said, guiding Joseph toward the door.

"Thanks" Joseph replied meekly.

They left the apartment through the main entrance and headed down several corridors and down a flight of stairs. "Have you ever been to Rochester before" Alexander asked, as the two approached a series of large windows from which they could see the city scape of the capital of the Mercian kingdom.

"I was born in the city.. here at the palace. My father's bad relationship with his brother, the late King William, resulted in us all getting banished from court, I was only 2 when we left." Joseph explained Prince Stephan's story.

"Oh.. I didn't know that.. I'm sorry." Alexander said apologetically.

"Don't worry about it, Queen Mary was kind enough to invite me back to court... she didn't share her father's grievances. I only wish my mother could have seen the city again before she died." Joseph continued with a somber tone, he leaned on the window ledge and looked distantly into the city.

Alexander didn't reply, he just stood next to Joseph and looked out on the city.

"How long have you been here?" Joseph asked.

"We've been here ever since we were driven out of Montrose by those scum of Aquitaine." the words of Aquitaine were like venom on his tongue.

The Dukes of Montrose were the viceroys of the Duchy of Montrose, a Mercian province to the south that Aquitaine had taken about ten years ago on the orders of the now deceased King Louis. The Ducal family had fled to Rochester, both for their lives and with the hope of getting King William to commit solders to retake the province. After months of posturing the King chose did nothing. More than nothing, he decided to keep the peace with Aquitaine, he ordered the Montrose estates and wealth to be confiscated, their position and rank was reduced to almost nothing. Fortunately the former Duke had the foresight to ally with William's daughter the Princess Mary, who was never expected to become Queen. When she did take the throne, ahead of her brothers, she returned the wealth and estates to the the Montrose family and vowed to retake the province. Though she hadn't done so yet, the Duke never lost faith.

"Does the Queen plan to take the province back?" Joseph asked.

"She says that she does..." he started, unsure, "we have no reason to disbelive her. Queen Mary has been very good to us, where her father was cruel. It's not as if Aquitaine's pathetic excuse for a King could do anything to stop us"

"No" Joseph agreed, clearly the Mercian's didn't think highly of King Laurence, though saying such things about an enemy was common in this case they were deadly right.

"Besides, it may not need to go that far. If King Laurence's fool cousin decides to make a challenge for the throne then we can just take take it... and more, and Aquitaine will be unable to stop us" He said confidently.

The Duke of Lyon might not be happy to know that his ideas of challenging Laurence for the throne are common as gossip... and worse jokes, at the court of Mercia. They clearly don't rate the Duke's chances, or they're banking on the instability creating a weakness, which undoubtedly it would.
1553112221211121.title: Alexander shows Stephan around the palace.

15531122212111211.content:
Joseph and Alexander walked away from the window and down another flight of stairs, Joseph noticed that this floor was considerably busier than what he'd seen so far. The realisation of his position suddenly dawned on him when he noticed Queen Mary and her entourage, which included the Dowager Duchess of Montrose, enter from a hallway into this grand hall, one of the palace's great courtyards. He was in the very centre of power for the Kingdom of Mercia, the havoc he could reek here could cause the collapse of the Kingdom. He could assure that Mercia never again rose to threaten Aquitaine.

"Come..." Alexander said, tugging Joseph's arm, "this way"

Joseph did as he was bid, and followed Alexander, he couldn't stop himself from looking back at the Queen who had stopped to talk to somebody. As Joseph extended his vision he could see the extent of security, Royal Guardsmen lined every door way, stood either end of every pillar. And what of the courtiers? How many were armed? The momentary foolishness of the grandeur of his success suddenly made Joseph feel uneasy. This centre of such power is quite likely the most secure place in the entire world. Joseph would have to be far more clever and inventive if he was to succeed than take such obvious action here.

"What you looking at Stephan?" Alexander asked, noticing that Joseph's attention was else where.

"Oh.. nothing. Sorry." Joseph responded, refocusing his attention on Alexander.

"The Queen?" Alexander deduced.

"I..I suppose so" Joseph admitted.

"She is a.... strange human being" Alexander commented, he turned with Joseph took look across the room at Queen Mary who was conversing with important knights and noblemen.

"Strange?" Joseph wondered.

"I've never known anyone quite like her. Power doesn't usually come to women, and Queen Mary holds more than any man in our history. Nobody would ever question her authority...." he paused, though the words sounded somewhat derogatory they were said with much admiration, "They say the Aqutiaines call her the 'She Wolf of Mercia'."

Joseph knew it was true, he'd heard Duke Charlie curse that 'shewolf' on many occasions. Queen Mary would probably consider it a term of endearment. "I'm not surprised"

"Yeah." Alexander agreed, after a few seconds he turned away and guided Joseph toward one of the many of the grand hall's exits, "are you hungry?"

"I am rather" Joseph admitted. Joseph had been trained and conditioned so he could do with out food, though that didn't mean he didn't get hungry. Infact he did so on a regular basis, only he'd learnt how to ignore and endure it.

"Me too!" Alexander said, "come this way"
15531122212111211.title: Go and have some lunch.

155311222121112112.content:
Alexander lead Joseph out of the grand hall, down a series of corridors to another state room. As they passed the two Royal Guardsmen at the door, Joseph peered around the room. The room was full of nobles, some important and others less so. Like before most were stood in little groups talking... conspiring perhaps, others were seated eating and drinking. Joseph noticed that the food was at buffets and that they would have to help themselves, not that this was a bad thing. Contrary to Aqutiane slurs, the food here looked great, and no doubt tasted just as good. There were meats, pastries, cakes and much more, Joseph was impressed by the choice.

Alexander tugged Joseph's sleeve suggestively, and headed towards one of the tables. After picking up a plate he started piling food onto it until there wasn't any space left.

"You eating anything?" Alexander asked, looking at Joseph's empty plate.

"Oh yeah.. of course" Joseph replied absent mindedly, "you go start eating."

"Okay!" Alexander chuckled, "I'll just go and sit down over there."

Joseph turned his head slightly as Alexander went and sat down next to a window that overlooked the palace gardens, Joseph quickly turned back to the table and started placing a wide variety of food onto his plate, after grabbing a drink from the previous table he went and joined Alexander.
155311222121112112.title: A grand lunch.

choices: Alexander finished Joseph's cake for him.
1553112221211121121.content:
As Joseph took a seat on the opposite side of the table, facing Alexander, he couldn't help but notice how much the young Duke had already eaten. Almost half his plate was already clear, and considering how much he'd piled onto it that was saying something. As Joseph took his first bite, he could see why, the food was delicious and moreish. He started all but shoveling the food into his mouth, at a pace that would give Alexander a run for his money. After about five to ten minuets his plate was completely clear.

"You've finally finished..! Want to go get pudding?" Alexander asked, he stood not waiting for an answer.

"Good thinking" Joseph agreed. As he followed Alexander to the table with the sweet foods on it, he noticed the servants were quick to remove their empty plates. Once again Alexander was far quicker serving himself up, as Joseph hesitated. After much consideration Joseph took a slice of chocolate cake, grabbed another drink and returned to the table where Alexander was waiting.

"Is that all your having?" he asked, looking at Joseph's relatively empty plate - with only one slice of cake on it.

"I, erm" Joseph murmured, Alexander had again filled his plate, he had several slices of cake, and an assortment of pastries on his plate. He wasn't sure why he found the fact that this young Duke stuffed himself with so much fattening food. Courts of all kind were always places of overindulging. Even for relatively thin guys like Alex.

"Here, you have this.. I'll get my self some more" he pushed his plate infront of Alexander, not taking no for an answer he went back to the table and returned with another full plate of deserts.
1553112221211121121.title: Alexander ate really fast.

15531122212111211211.content:
The cakes and pastries were nicer even that the savory course, after he'd mopped up the cream on the plate with his last piece of cake he lent back into his chair and breathed pleasurably. "That was great."

"Exactly" Alexander agreed, as he spooned the last crumbs of cake on his plate into his mouth.

"I don't think I've ever eaten so much." Joseph said looking over the table at Alex's equally empty plate.

"Oh... court will change that. You'll be eating like this most days" Alexander pointed out.

Joseph didn't take much notice as he leaned his head back casually. After a couple of minuets he sat up in his chair again, as he noticed Alexander do the same.

"Want to go back to the apartments for a nap" Alexander asked, "I normally do"

"Good thinking... I could definitely do with a nap" Joseph said, rubbing his stomach softly.

They both stood up and Joseph followed Alexander upto the room. The walk back to the apartment was about was about ten minuets long, though they were so full it took them getting on for twenty. Once they got back they parted and went into their separate rooms, as he looked upon his bed and considered changing Joseph noticed his bed was completely unmade, he left the room once again and knocked on Alexander's door.

"Yep, Come in" Alexander shouted to Joseph.

Joseph opened the door and entered Alexander's beautifully, and ornately decorated room, "hey, my bed is unmade..." he said looking upon Alexander's large four-poster bed.

"Sorry, the wouldn't have expected the room to be made up until tonight" Alexander explained.

"It's no problem" Joseph said turning and heading back towards the door.

"You may as well just kip on my bed, we're only napping... there's room enough for two" Alexander offered.

"Cheers" Joseph replied, he closed the door slipped his shoes off and climbed on to Alexander's bed.

"Your welcome" Alexander said kindly, he too removed his shoes... in more of a kick. Before climbing onto the bed he unbuttoned his shirt and slung it onto the bedside table, "At that's better"

Joseph loosened his own shirt, and shifted up on the bed as Alexander sat beside him, he looked at Alexander's stomach. It was pudgy, as he'd thought earlier, Joseph couldn't help glancing at the deep belly button and the flab that protruded over his waist as he sat, as he did he rubbed his own stomach which felt round and incredibly bloated. "Tell me, what did you mean about eating like that most days?"

"When?" Alexander wondered, before remembering, "oh back in the dining hall. Oh just that meals are nearly always so grand at court, you get a taste for it"

"Really, cos I ate such allot today" Joseph said.

"Yeah, so did I"

"I wasn't even going to have that much cake!" Joseph chuckled.

"I thought you'd be hungry if you didn't" Alexander smiled

"Haha.. no! I'm stuffed" Joseph said patting his belly.

"Before I was allowed to actually attend court, I was as thin as a rake" Alexander admitted, patting his own stomach.

"You were?" Joseph replied, "I can still see that from the rest of your body. Since when have you attended court?"

"I started regally attending earlier this year... and I noticed you said 'were'" Alexander said with a broad grin on his face.

"Oh, uh.. sorry. Are... sorry"

"No, I was only kidding. My stomach has become somewhat flabby"

"You look fine" Joseph tried to placate.

"Thanks. I put on a stone from in like a couple of months.. thankfully it slowed right down!"

"How much" Joseph asked, he felt that he was getting a bit nosey. But he was shocked about open Alexander was to him, as if they'd grown up as brothers.. as if Joseph really was who he said he was.

"I must weigh about ten and a half stone...perhaps getting on for eleven." he added, "hope not though"

"I'm about ten my self"

"But your not in the least bit fat" Alexander pointed out, he stretched out his hand at patted Joseph's stomach, "yet.."

The two continued to chat, until they eventually settled down for nap.
15531122212111211211.title: Joseph finishes his plate

155311222121112112111.content:
Joseph eyes flickered as he awoke to the sound of a clock chiming, beside him Alexander was still asleep cuddled into him and resting his head on Joseph's chest. It was a shame that Joseph had to move, because he was really comfortable and relaxed. He wasn't sure how he'd come to be sleeping so close to the young duke, and in such a sexual position. His hand sat upon Alexander's underwear, right around his genitals, Joseph instinctively moved it before Alexander became aware, and began to shuffle along the bed away from him.

As he felt his bed partner begin to stir, Joseph placed his hands around Alexander's warm shoulders and rolled him to the right. He held his position for a couple of seconds before it became clear that the young duke had settled down again. Now that he was unrestricted he slid off the side of the bed and picked up his clothes and began to redress.

"You're up" Alexander said looking up at the half naked boy dressing beside the bed.

"Yes... sorry if I woke you." Joseph replied, he placed his shirt around on and started fastening it up.

Alexander looked up at the clock, "probably good that you did, I'd slept for longer than I intended. We've got to attend court in just over half an hour"

"Glad you remembered" Joseph smiled.
155311222121112112111.title: They wake up cuddled together...

1553112221211121121112.content:
Alexander sprung out of bed, tripping on his trousers as he stepped on the floor.

Joseph smiled, "Are you okay?"

"I'm fine" he replied as he speedily returned to his feet.

Joseph couldn't help gazing at Alexander's nude upper body as he hastily dressed. There was something about the young duke that he found really alluring, in an odd kind of way. He was clumsy and good humoured, much unlike the pompous and strait laced Duke de Lyon, his lover, and lord and master. Alexander was thinly built, his body was untoned and pudgy, especially his stomach. The Duke de Lyon on the other hand had a great physique, he was muscled and athletic. The boy stood infront of him was completely unlike the Duke de Lyon, the only person Joseph had ever loved. Yet Joseph couldn't help feeling something for him.

"Ready to go Stephan?" Alexander asked as he did up the final buttons on his shirt.

"Are you sure we're dressed okay to attend the Queen?" Joseph asked looking at himself in the mirror. He'd looked smart enough before he'd undressed to have a nap, but he now looked somewhat scruffy. Alexander who's hair had the classic bed-head look, looked even worse. His shirt was untucked, his trousers uneven, and his shoes untied.
1553112221211121121112.title: Alexander gets up.

15531122212111211211122.content:
"Perhaps you're right" Alexander agreed, looking at himself in the mirror.

"Shall I go find a valet, or page?" Joseph asked, "do you 'have' a valet or page?"

"Erm..." Alexander hesitated, "we do.. but I'd rather mother didn't find out that I'd had a nap in the middle of the day, especially if it makes me late for a meeting with the Queen."

"Does she need to know" Joseph wondered.

"No... but we have a small staff, and believe me - mother would find out if one was called away from his regular duties to attend me during the day"

"I understand" Joseph agreed.

"I'm sure we can do it ourselves" Alexander suggested, "we're not halfwhits"

Joseph smiled, "not both of us"

Henri was seated next to him, in a similar level of bloat. His eyes were half closed, and his hands rested happily on his rolls. He's undid his pants and shirt, as well. Crumbs and icing were smeared on his chubby cheeks. He looked like a fat cat that had eaten the canary. Henry reckoned that he probably looked similar.

"That was so goood." He moaned. Henri only burped in response.

From the kitchens, Annemarie returned, "Oh no! You poor dears, are don't yet?"

Henry opened his eyes again and groaned. "Couldn't eat another bite-" He started to say, before he caught sight of what Annemarie had in her hands. The elderly woman was carrying an enormous chocolate cake, decorated with delicate sugar flowers. The cake was clearly heavy and at least three layers tall. Annemarie heaved it over to the counter and frowned at them.

"Such a shame..." she said, "Everyone finished eating before we could unveil this cake..." Such a shame.

Henry glanced over at Henri. The younger boy was already licking his lips greedily. Biting his lip, Henry glanced over at the cake. It looked so delicious, but... Henri 's stomach gurgled in warning.

He would have turned her down, had Henri not said, "If you can't handle it, I'm sure I can polish it off."

Henry narrowed his eyes, "Oh, I can handle it," he grumbled, ignoring his stomach groaning in protest.

The two boys squared off against each other. Each sitting down on the opposite side of the cake. With little ceremony they began devouring the cake, almost stabbing it with their forks and not even bothering to cut themselves pieces. Henry ate quickly, barely even pausing to enjoy the cake. All he was concerned with was shoving more cake down his throat than Henri. After a few, furious mouthfuls, he could almost feel the cake hitting his stomach. Still he kept chewing and swallowing.

There was only a quarter of the cake left, when Henri threw his fork down. He moaned cupping his belly in both hands. He started to say something, but cut himself off with another unhappy moan. Henry tore his eyes away from the cake to look at the Marquis. He was leaning back in his chair, gently massaging his swollen gut. Frosting and ganauche were smeared all over his lips and cheeks. Crumbs dotted his breasts and tummy.

Henry felt himself smirk, "Tapping out are we?" he asked.

"Ooooooo-urp- m'belly hurts so bad-urp!" Henri licked his lips happily and belched again.

Suddenly filled with determination, Henry scooped up another forkful of cake, while Henri moaned and rubbed his belly. He was determined to eat more cake than Henri. He was a king , after all. Shouldn't kings be allowed to glut themselves?

Almost immediately, his stomach began to protest. It sloshed and rolled noisily, but he continued to eat, driven by an almost mindless determination to beat Henri. With a little groan he scooped up the last of the cake and shoved it triumphantly in his mouth. He swallowed painfully and let himself flop back in his chair. Unable to hold it back, he belched loudly, but it did little to ease the pain in his belly.

Henri was looking at him with half-lidded eyes, hands still on his belly. "We should--ooooh--do this again sometime."

Henry burped in agreement.

Its frozen seas and diffuse population have seen to that. 15533.title: More choices...

155331.content:
The spring air was cool and refreshing on Alexander's pale skin, it was far more akin to the springs of Ruscovia than the unbearable heat further south in, and around, the Antiqua peninsular. Though Rolan had disagreed with Alexander, he relished the warmth and the luxuries of the south, so he and Alexander parted company temporarily as Alexander journeyed back North to Mercia. Prince Alexander knew, even if only for himself, that he had to observe the goings on of these southerly Kingdoms and assess there strengths and weaknesses.

Most of what he had descovered were screamingly obvious to those here, and he felt like an outsider just by asking the questions. The most powerful three Kingdoms are exactly as told in Sartov: Aquitaine, Castile and Mercia.

Aquitaine is said to be the most powerful of the three, it's armies are legion and it's territorial holdings great indeed - but it is held back by it's child king, and power hungry regents.

Castile is very much the former powerhouse ignoring it's slow decline, though few people would put it as bluntly as that. It's once vast territorial holdings have been superseded by Aquitaine expansion, it's royal family is debauched, and it's decrepit King is the only thing holding the nation back from the precipice of chaos.

Then finally, there is Mercia. A country hated venomously in Aquitaine - though beloved by all who dislike Aquitaine. It's territorial holdings are impressive, but it's army is quite unremarkable. The most popular talking point on people's lips is it's King, or he should say Queen. For Mercia is ruled by a women, Queen Mary. Surprisingly enough, what all detractors perceive as a weakness is actually strength, regardless there view is a grave and dangerious underestimation. Of the three Great Kingdoms, she is the only leader with any competence - her court is undivided, and her Navy is nothing short of extraordinary. Alexander had seen just part of it for himself as his ferry carried him into port.

If any of the three are a threat to Ruscovia, then it's Mercia. Castile's decline and instablitiy speaks for it's self. Though Aquitaine's armies are massive, and powerful, Alexander couldn't see how they could threaten Ruscovia, or why they would want to. Such an invasion would be fraught with risk, with few tangable benifets. Mercia on the other hand would threaten Ruscovia in different ways, Alexander doubted Queen Mary would seak terreotiral control. It's ships are more than powerful and numerious enough to blockade traderoutes, which would further starve his people. To the releif, if Queen Mary was shrewd, Mercia would seek domion over him, and Ruscovia.. Even without meeting her, Queen Mary's Imperial ambitions are clear, just as are Aquitaines.

Undoubtably one way of securing Ruscovia and improving it's economy might be allying with one of the three. When Castile's King dies, then the resulting chaos will mean civil war, and Alexander doubts it will remain 'civil' for long.

Alexander followed the other passengers as he made his first steps into Mercia. The port was only a short ride from the Rochester, it's capital city, which he was anxious to see for himself. Beyond that, he was starving.
155331.title: Alexander, Crown Prince of Ruscovia, Baron of Tiev

1553312.content:
Prince Alexander looked around him, there were four extravagantly dressed guardsmen ushering him towards a waiting carriage. Clearly, somebody had anticipated his arrival. He nodded at them before gracefully entering the golden carriage. He wondered if the extravagance and efficiency was an example of what was to come. Or was it simply bravado. For Mercia and Aquitaine seemed intent on constantly outdoing one another.

His stomach growled loudly, he was starving, he recoiled slightly at the thought that the driver or somebody might have heard. Alexander was use to the hunger and it didn't use to faze him; despite being Royalty food wasn't always plentiful at the Palace of Sartov back in Russcovia, at least not food that he found particularly appetising. Though after a few weeks in Florentine and the other city states of Antiqua, Alexander had quickly allowed himself to become bothered when he was hungry.

It wasn't a long way to Rochester at any rate, he could cope with the hunger until then with no problem. With any luck he'd have the opportunity to eat soon after he arrived. He placed his head back softly on the cushioned headrest. It was a mistake thinking back to the cuisine of the southerly city states, it had only made him more hungry. His younger brother Rolan who had remained there could testify to that, unsurprising that he had chosen to remain there longer. Alexander remembered Florentine, it was hot - unbearable as far as he was concerned - but unlike it's citizens he wasn't able to dress weather appropriate. Had he removed any layers then he would have gotten sunburned.

After about half an hour the carriage drew though the gates of Rochester. The city was magnificent, even from the city gates he could see the Grand Basilica looming over the entire city, the towers and the domb are likely visible from all points in the city, it was apparently positioned in the centre point in the city infront of the mile long The Mall that lead to the Royal Palace. If this carriage was sent courtesy of the Palace, that was where he was heading.
1553312.title: Ride straight for the capital.

15533121.content:
The Royal Palace was indeed where he was heading, after another half an hour from the gates they reached the Grand Basilica and entered the mall in direction of the Royal Palace. The City was massive, and impressive. He couldn't help but imagine how he might improve Sartov to bring it to the grandeur of cities such as this. The Mall was a mile long, and plastered with royal flags, all along it people were milling about, talking, looking over at the river, basking in their nations power and pomposity. After passing through an arch the Palace itself swept into view.

The treas and the arch had obscured it as he traveled up The Mall, but no longer. It was magnificent. He found it difficult to describe it. He imagined the Ruscovian Palace might have been that impressive had it been maintained better. The carriage took him around the side, and through a gilded gate, after stopping, the door was opened and he was ushered out onto a red carpet. The four guards formed an honour guard standing either side of a middle aged man, and the Russcovian ambassador.

"Your Royal Highness" he said with a sweeping bow, as Prince Alexander carefully stept out.

"A pleasure" Alexander said, performing a lower bow, "may I ask who you are."

"I am the Deputy Lord Chancellor. Had we had more notice of your highness's arrival then we would have been better prepared." He explained, "The Queen has agreed to your Ambassador's request, and has granted you apartments here at court for the duration of your visit."

Alexander was impressed, the ambassador had not been caught off guard with his arrival and had made preparations with the Queen. "Ze Queen is very generous" Alexander responded, following his ambassador and this Deputy Lord Chancellor.

His apartments were beautiful and spacious. It came with four double bedrooms (of which he only needed one), a lounge, study and dining room. All the rooms were large. The ambassador had also arranged for his son, and the son of another Russcovian nobleman to serve as his pages (male equivalents to ladies-in-waiting he understood), they would dress him, provide him with advice and companionship. Glorified servants, was another way of thinking about it. They were both nice lads though, one was 17 the other 22, both were quiet and dignified. They both clearly had a good understanding of the court, and had already provided Alexander with a few useful insights.

He only had a short time to talk with them, and to look around his apartment, before they informed him that they were instructed to take him to a meeting with the Queen at the hour.

155331211.title: Meeting the Queen.

1553312111.content:
The meeting with Queen Mary went better than expected. She tripped him up a number of times, but he got the sense that she respected him. She had suggested that Alexander go and meet other members of the Royal Family in the state room, while she she continues her duties.

"You must be Prince Alexander" a voice said from across the empty state room.

There was only one person in the room, Alexander politely walked over to speak with him. It was Prince James, Mercia's Crown Prince. On sight he almost swooned. The Prince was incredibly attractive, perhaps rivaling his own good looks. He was dressed far more richly than Alexander, and had an extravagant head piece in true Mercian fashion.

"Yes, and you must be Prince James" Alexander responded, taking a seat next to him.

James laughed in response to their introduction, "May with dispense with the formalities, we are both Princes. You may call me James" he replied kindly.

Alexander smiled back, ignoring his brother's whores and manwhores seemed to worth it as he looked into Prince James's eyes. He felt so stupid. "Likewise, call me Alexander."

James looked back at Prince Alexander intently, he too had noticed Alexander's attractiveness. Strangely the rumours never mentioned his devastating good looks, only he and his brothers slightly weird escapades. "Tell me Alexander... are all Ruscovians as attractive as you?" he asked.

Was Prince James flirting? Alexander asked himself, that questioned seemed pretty sensual. He smiled back, "no.. just me."

"Oh?" He replied, sounding oddly satisfied with the answer.

Alexander took the calculated decision that James must be flirting, and placed his hand on James', to see if he recoiled. Embarrassment meant little to Alexander, it seldom affected him. He wasn't disappointed, James didn't move his hand. He only looked up, into Alexander's eyes.

As the two drifted closer together, James first rose from the seat, not letting go of Alexander's hand - prompting him to do the same. Alexander suddenly moved and kissed James streight on the lips. To his joy, James accepted it and placed his arms around Alexander. He couldn't believe how quickly this happened, he'd barely been in the room for 5 minutes. The two moved closer together as they kissed, before finally breaking apart as they heard someone walking down the outside corridor.

"That was great" James replied.

"Yes" was all Alexander replied.
1553312111.title: Goes to meet other members of the royal family.

a visitor had arrived for Alexander.
15533121112.content:
James and Alexander stared at one another, a subtle electricity humming between them as the footsteps faded into nothingness. Both were breathing slightly heavily, their chests rising up and down from within their tunics. After a moment, Alexander reached out a hand to caress James' face and the blond prince closed his eyes in content.

"Visit my chambers later, if you like," Alexander said softly as he drew his hand away and straightened his posture. "We could continue to get to know one another."

James smiled, his cheeks tinged a shade of rose. "As your host, shouldn't it be you visiting my chambers?" he asked, crossing his arms.

"The best hosts always cater to the desires of their guests," Alexander met James' smile with one of his own, "And I suspect that I will see your chambers before my time in Mercia is at its end. Should I receive an invitation, I would come, of course." Alexander placed a hand on James' shoulder then let it drift south until his fingers were hovering over the blond's collarbone. "I remain at the mercy of your hospitality, James. Do stop by if you get the opportunity."

The Ruscovian prince and the Mercian prince locked eyes, various emotions burning in their eyes, and then Alexander turned and left the state room. Outside, he was quickly joined by his pages, who took up positions on either side of him as he strode back to his apartments.

"Forgive me, but I must ask for your names again," Alexander said as his pages synced their strides with his own, "I'm afraid that they've slipped my mind amongst all of today's events."

***

"Now, then...what can you tell me about Prince James?" Alexander had waited until they had reached the privacy of his apartments before voicing this question. He'd draped himself across a luxurious sofa in his lounge, a comfortable room covered in green fabrics and tapestries with a large fireplace on one wall. Servants wood be arriving soon enough with a late lunch, but until then, Alexander had some inquiries for his pages.

"Highness," Misha, the older and taller of his two pages, began, "The entire Mercian people wishes to go to bed with him. They differ only in whether they want to take him or be taken by him." Alexander nodded thoughtfully at Misha's response. Such bluntness was valued by Ruscovians. And Misha, with his dark hair and wiry, but muscled body, was clearly a Ruscovian.

"I had heard that he was...popular, yes. Now I see why. But what about James himself? How does he spend his days?" Alexander asked. Across from him, seated in two plush armchairs, Misha and Nikolai shared a look. Unlike Misha, Nikolai, with his freckled face and pudgy midsection, appeared less of a Ruscovian, though he could be just as shrewd as his older counterpart.

"The prince's life is one of constant leisure," Nikolai offered, "He meets with the royal tailors and jewelers monthly to commission various new clothes and baubles. Some call him vain, but I think it would more accurate to say that Prince James has a vested interest in...fashion." Nikolai scrunched his face together, struggling for the words, "He...likes pretty things."

"A pretty thing that likes pretty things..." Alexander mused, then chuckled. "I suppose that is why he has taken a fondness toward me. He leads a very carefree life, then?"

Misha and Nikolai nodded.

"Yes," Misha affirmed, "Sometimes he quarrels with his brother, the Prince George, and sometimes Queen Mary tasks him with a minor state function, but other than that..." Misha trailed off and turned toward Nikolai, who shrugged.

"He meets with his staff, the tailors, the jewelers. He dines - on sweets especially - and bathes with imported oils. When it's warm, he reads poetry on his balcony." Nikolai tapped a finger on his chin in thought. "Ahh, he occasionally spends time with a cousin of his. Lord John, a minor noble. Though I don't think I've seen them together much lately. They would spar in one of the courtyards, though their sparring tended to quickly devolve into simple wrestling."

Alexander's brow furrowed. What a strange pastime for James, who otherwise appeared to be a very sedentary prince. And who was this John? He would have to look into it later. "And romantically?" Alexander asked after a pause, "I take it that James is a lover of men."

Misha and Nikolai nodded. If either were disturbed by their own Crown Prince asking such a question, neither appeared disturbed. Perhaps they knew of the exchange Alexander had shared with James in the state room. "Rumors suggest as much," Misha said, "Some say that's the real reason why Mary ascended the throne, but they're the stupid ones who say that."

"More telling," Nikolai cut in, "are the young lads. Sometimes minor nobles, sometimes the common son of a merchant or stable hand. 'Friends,' the prince calls them. They join the prince as pages, though none seem to serve more than a year in his service. More than one occasion has passed where a maid has spied the prince giving them his kisses."

"Hmm. Interesting," Alexander said. So James' receptiveness in the state room had not been a product of whim. That was good to know. "He tires of them in so quick a time?"

"It would appear so, Highness," Misha responded, looking almost concerned for his crown prince. Perhaps he did know Alexander's intentions. "Or perhaps it was they who tired of the prince. For all his quirks, Prince James has not a cruel bone in his body. If any in his service declared that they wished to leave it, he would permit it if it meant their happiness."

Alexander rubbed his chin, considering that possibility. "What," he asked, after a moment, "did his last pages cite as their reasoning for leaving the prince?"

Misha and Nikolai blinked. "Why," Misha said, after sharing a glance with Nikolai, "I believe personal reasons were not an issue for the last pages to leave Prince James' keeping."

"The reasons being?" Alexander prompted, one dark brow raised in questioning.

"Health," Nikolai offered, squirming slightly in his seat, "Edward and Mark - those were their names - could no longer provide one essential, if rarely used, service: defense. And so Queen Mary released both of them from service, actually."

"An accident?" Alexander asked, curious.

"No," Misha said, his expression strangely sheepish, "Obesity. You see, during the year they served as the prince's pages, Edward and Mark ate themselves quite large. I don't believe they had a stitch of clothing that fit them when they left."

***

Some hours later, Alexander had retired to his lounge again. Shortly after he'd dismissed Misha and Nikolai, a small army of servants had arrived with a late lunch. It had been a herculean meal; he had seen nothing like it before, not even at Ruscovian state functions, which were considered grand feasts in his homeland. He'd been surprisingly hungry and eager to try some of the southern delicacies laid out before him, but Alexander was still surprised that he'd allowed his appetite to get away from him so quickly. That was Rolan's downfall, not his.

After gorging himself, he'd changed clothes, exchanging his more elaborate traveling clothes for a fur robe, and returned to the lounge. His robe was comfortable, especially compared to the traveling clothes, which had gotten a bit tight around his stomach after eating so much. It also left a slice of his naked chest exposed, which he though James might appreciate, though now Alexander was beginning to wonder if James was going to stop by at all.

Thankfully, at that moment, a servant appeared to announce that...

1553321.content:
Rolan was slapped awake by undoubtedly his brother. His head hurt from his tavern-hopping the night before. "Dunce, wake up," Rolan heard his brother calling to him through a foggy sleep, "we have a meeting with Mr. David Smith, the Queen's leading finance minister to help us get Ruscovia into a more economically viable place." All Rolan heard, however, was that he and his brother had to meet with another stuffy, aristocratic bureaucrat.

         Rolan washed, changed his clothes, and got a cup of black tea and a glass of cold water to ease his headache and wake himself up. He only made his problem worse. A good breakfast, however, eased Rolan's pain to a more tolerable level to allow him to set out for the Queen's Palace. And having arrived, the two were shown to a small conference-room that looked far too small to be handling any sort of the complex affairs that a Treasury should have had.

         David Smith was not an aristocrat. He was a thin, aging commoner with a nasaly voice and an irritating demeanor, a look of pity and condescencion. Rolan was already in a bad mood, and this man had only made it worse. The man gave a boring, jargon-filled interlude before Rolan decided to doze off before he heard the other man say, "Perhaps your brother would be a good fit for a finance minister under the right conditions."

         Rolan heard his brother laughing in true mirth, a reaction for only the best of jokes, because Alexander was not a man for humor. But all Rolan could say was, "What?" Smith chuckled and replied, "Well, My Lord, if you had listened, you might have heard me say that in regulating the economy from a policy standpoint, he who generally governs best, governs least. So perhaps you should be a finance minister because you seem so unwilling to govern."

         Rolan allowed himself a chuckle, sat up straight, and, for the first time in his life, was actually interested in learning something academic. The man spoke well and in terms that Rolan could digest easily; Rolan despised jargon and nonsense of that sort and only used jargon which he had defined and illustrated with examples.

         "I'm sorry for the lack of detail in my explanation. I can, however, send my finest advisor, Mr. Adam Ricardo, with you to Ruscovia if you so desire," Mr. Smith concluded before Rolan replied, "If you would, sir, I'm sire my brother would appreciate it. And I know that I would."

         Suddenly…

15533211.content:
A messenger came in and knelt before Alexander and spoke, "Your majesty, Prince…No. King Alexander, I regretfully inform you that your father has been assassinated in the capital by some firebrand. Your presence in the capital is required immediately." The messenger left, leaving the room stupefied and eerily quiet. Finally, Smith spoke, "Your majesty, would you please, please accept my offer of aid?"

         Rolan turned furiously to the insolent man who nattered on about economics when he had been just told that the sovreign of a nation had been assassinated. Suddenly, Alexander turned to his brother with one question: Why would someone do this? Certainly, his father had been a reactionary, certainly, Ruscovia was not a better place because of his father; but what would killing their father have done?

         Rolan pondered this question for a moment before he responded, "Maybe this man wants you for his king. Maybe he wants a more liberal Ruscovia, one in which there is no special status under the law, one where a man is free to do what he wills." Alexander smiled; he knew his brother wasn't dumb and could think when he wanted to.

         "This man was a call to action. Mr. Smith, please, would you send your students as economic advisors to Ruscovia?" Alexander asked with a wan smile. "With pleasure," the man chirped cheerily. Mr. Smith was amazed at the cool heads of the two boys. They would make a fine king and Treasury Secretary, he thought to himself.


         At their father's funeral, the head of the Church had asked Alexander to speak. So he had. He layed out that his father was a strong-willed but inept reactionary. He would do differently. He would allow Mercian and Saxon educators to come and teach Ruscovia's population how to read and write. He would give the Duma more of a say in how the state would be run. He would remove the unjust powers that nobleman had over their serfs which hindered the economic progress of Ruscovia. He would liberalize Ruscovia and make it a great nation again.

         His message caused visible discontent among the nobles. He was their leader, but they still wielded great influence in Ruscovia. Rolan had avised his brother to strip the nobles of much of their power and would force them to earn a living by producing something of value to others. Petty bureaucrats had led to the corruption that plagued Ruscovia to that day.

         But reforming a bureaucracy was always difficult. So instead of reforming the bureaucracy, Alexander had decided to cut it altogether. Rolan thought it to be brilliant. Rolan had been instated as head of the Treasury with the advice of Mr. Ricardo as the de facto leader on cutting regulations. Tariffs were slashed, regulations were slashed, taxes cut massively. All of these things were with the consent of the Duma. Mr. Ricardo showed Rolan all the implications of policies and taught him to think things of a policy through to their logical conclusions; and he approved Rolan when he did and chastised him when he didn't.

         Meanwhile, foreign investments from Mercia, Saxony, and Florentine. There was initial reaction and mob violence from natvist reactionaries, which was punished severely and quickly vanished. But resentment rarely truly dissipates, and the Trust Square Incident was no exception.
