15533221.content:
The hot sun shined upon Jaca as Edward stood on his balcony and gazed upon the city that was the capital of his knew Kingdom. Jaca had once been the grandest city in the all the world, back in Castile's glory days, centuries of decadence and depravity had left the great city but a shadow it's former self.

Being appointed King had been something Edward had never wanted, power was not something he craved, never mind the unbearable scorching heat. But a combination of Queen Mary's determination, and his parents ambition had meant he could not turn down the post. His coronation had been lavish, Edward suspected it perplexed locals as it was traditionally Mercian, like nothing they'd seen before, even now Courtiers refused to dress in traditional, not to mention simpler, Castilian dress. The extravagance of the Mercian court fashions were no less prevalent than in Mary's court back in Rochester. The idea of dressing, and behaving as the ousted regime did was repugnant to most of his courtiers, and though Edward's thoughts on the matter weren't quite as strong, he certainly agreed their opinion had merit. The majority of the women wore nothing on their heads, and their dresses were quite thin, and revealing; all unbecoming of women with noble blood. And the clothes of men were too simple, and drab. Courtiers said that the younger noblemen wore little more than underwear during the summer months, though Edward found it difficult to believe that Lords of Castile could have such little self-respect.

Edward stepped back into his chamber and saw an ageing man waiting patently for his attention. "Lord Chancellor"

"Your Royal Majesty" the Lord Chancellor said as he made a sweeping bow.

"Please take a seat" Edward offered, as he himself sat behind his grand desk, which had belonged to King Philip and all the great Kings of Castile.

"Thank you sire"

"What can I do for you" Edward asked, making a point to be polite.

"Our warships captured Ferdinand of Trastámara, pretender King of Castile, as he attempted to escape to the Free Cities."

"Excellent news, what has been done with him?" Edward asked, trying not to sound curious.

"We've bought him to the Palace" The Chancellor replied, "he has said nothing to nobody."

"Assemble the Lords of the Privy Council, and bring him before me in the Throne Room." Edward said, he flicked his wrist to indicate the Chancellor should leave his presence.
15533221.title: King Edward of {i}[Southern]{/i} Castile

155332211.content:
Edward sat uncomfortably on the Grand Throne of Castile in full knowledge that the man who should rightfully be seated on it was soon to be bought into his presence. His Lords and Ladies of the Privy Council were stood seated on lower down and less opulent seats to the sides of him, and many of his courtiers lined each side of the throne room various groups laughing, talking, gossiping and scheming - as they always were.

As the heralds trumpets sounded and "Ferdinand of Trastámara" was announced the courtiers were quickly fell in to silence, the boy Prince who walked in wasn't what most were expecting. He had been dressed in a way befitting the new court, not the traditional Castilian garb many couriers were hoping for so that they might gasp in disgust.

Edward of course knew that he wouldn't be dressed as such, he had ordered that he be dressed appropriately. He didn't want to humiliate him by having him in the Throne Room in the rags he was captured in, nor could he allow the pretender prince to dress as he wishes. To his surprise, the curly haired prince was actually quite the pretty boy; his posture and expression appeared to be both charming and innocent - not at all what Edward expected from one as famously flamboyant as Ferdinand of Trastámara.

"It's a pleasure to meet you Ferdinand of Trastámara" Edward said warmly to the Castilian boy of around his age, that stood before him.
155332211.title: Ferdinand of Trastámara is brought before King ...

choices: Edward receives a letter from Queen Mary.
Ferdinand requests an audience with Edward, as he is about to go to bed.
1553322111.content:
"The King addressed you boy" Lady Catherine shouted venomously at Ferdinand. Catherine the Duchess of Montrose was one of Queen Mary's closest friends, she was Mary's voice on his Privy Council, and a very vocal voice at that. Edward knew that her vocal attack at Ferdinand was in defence of Queen Mary's dignitary, not Edward's.

Ferdinand didn't even flinch, he didn't even react at all to Lady Catherine. Fortunately that despite being quick to shout, Lady Catherine didn't have a short temper and Ferdinand's defiance was unlikely to provoke another angry response from her.

"He doesn't have to reply... he need only listen." Edward in Catherine's direction, he was in fact speaking to all - in particularly Ferdinand. "your defiance is unnecessary, we are not going to make a martyr of you. I will raise you to the position of Duke, and your family with you, if you only recognise me as King of Castile" Edward offered, though he couldn't see that Ferdinand was going to agree, judging by his behaviour. Before he'd met him, Edward had suspected Ferdinand's love of luxury would make him see sense and give in. He wasn't famous for his strength of character.

"Take him to the tower to think it over" Edward said, signally two guards to approach and secure him. "If he fails to change his mind, then he will be sent to Rochester"
1553322111.title: Ferdinand refuses to speak.

choices: Edward tries again to speak with Ferdinand.
A feast in Empress Mary's honour.
15533221111.content:
Soon after Ferdinand was removed from the Throne Room, a dipomatic entourage sent by Queen Mary came before him. They requested to speak to Edward and his council, alone. The other courtiers were ushered out until the point where the room fell deathly silent, only then did Edward know they had all gone.

"You may speak" Edward at last announced.

"We bring news of an Act Passed by Parliament" the lead diplomat said.

"Go on" Edward said curiously, this was unusual news to be delivered to him like this - undoubtedly an edict would follow.

"It is the in Honour of Parliament, that by the Grace of God, her Majesty Mary Queen of Mercia is hereby declared Holy Empress." The diplomat read from the scroll held in front of him. "She will be crowed by the Pontifex Maximus himself, three months from now. Assuming peace can be attained, you will attend. She will shortly be making a state visit to Jaca where you, and your court must pledge all loyalty to her Imperial Majesty"

"It will be done." Edward bowed his head, his heart was beating at an alarming rate. This was an unexpected move. Mary had claimed the title that had gone unused for almost 500 years from the Old Imperium, the fact that the Pontifex was crowning her, it was likely that nobody else was going to be claiming the title. It suggested that her Imperial ambitions went beyond Castile.
15533221111.title: Edward receives a letter from Queen Mary.

155332211112.content:
In honour of Mary's declaration as Holy Empress, and her impending visit in the following days, the Mercian Court of Jaca had held a feast in her honour. In the grand chamber. Everyone at court was there, Edward had never seen the room so busy. Members of the deposed Royal Family and the former members of the Aristocracy still at court, had not attended, unsurprisingly. But Edward was sure in time he would change there minds.

Edward was pleased went the event finally ended, and he could head up to bed. He had eaten far too much, and very little of it healthy. Edward's bloated stomach was pressing against his corset making his clothing more uncomfortable than the heat had already done. He'd have to watch what he ate, as it wasn't as if he was still skinny as he had been as a child.
155332211112.title: A feast in Empress Mary's honour.

choices: Ferdinand of Trastámara is brought before Empress Mary.
1553322111121.content:
Mary had arrived at the Palace, at his whole court and council were awaiting her arrival in the throne room. The seats beside the throne of the privy council had been removed and had been replaced with the throne of the consort, placed a few places to the right and in front of the Grand Throne, and far lower down. Edward was to sit in that Throne as Mary sat in his usual throne, which had been decorated so that it suited her rank better, while she held Court. Ferdinand was to appear before her after the oaths had been sworn.

The knees of all in the room hit the ground as Mary and her ladies in waiting walked regally in. Mary was dressed in the most extravagant dress Edward had seen in his life, her headdress sparkling headdress easily double the size of anything worn by others. "Your Imperial Majesty" Edward said modestly.

She stretched out her hand so that Edward might kiss it.

"I so swear all allegiance to you Mary, Holy Empress, Queen of Mercia, Duchess of York, and your heirs and successors. So help me god."
1553322111121.title: The Throne Room, following day.

15533221111211.content:
Edward took a seat on the secondary throne positioned to the lower left of the one Empress Mary was sat in. Her entire manner was very regal and imperious, far more so than Edward ever remembered. She was sat straight with her arms leaning purposefully on the throne's armrests, as if she was having a portrait painted. Stood behind were three of Mary's ladies-in-waiting, and flanking the three of them were Mary's new Imperial Guard, formed from members of the Elite Knights of Rochester as Edward understood. All went with her new title presumably.

"Ferdinand of Trastámara" the Herald announced to the throne room.

He was accompanied by two of his Royal Guard, Edward had made an effort to keep Ferdinand's humiliation to a minimum. The two Guards stopped and nudged Ferdinand forward, he reluctantly approached the thrones and stopped four or five metres from them and didn't say a word.

"Speak" Mary said coldly. "Your King informs me that he made an offer"

Ferdinand remained silent, thus far he'd failed to provoke an angry reaction from anyone, Edward hoped dearly that Mary wouldn't crack.

Mary tapped her fingers repeatedly on the throne, seemingly impatiently.

"Speak" Edward demanded.

A resemblance of a smirk appeared on Ferdinand's face, before it vanished as he stared blankly in front of him.

"Very good" Mary clapped her hands "you haven't lost your sense of humour! To think the great House of Trastámara came to this. After centuries of your debauchery you stood on the precipice of the abyss...and you argued; you pulled down your great civilisation into chaos and still you fought each other. And now you stand before me, and you are silent."

It was naive for the thought of Mary cracking even crossed Edwards mind. Her mind games didn't seem to have provoked Ferdinand to respond yet, but if the thoughts were implanted in his mind, perhaps its enough.

"Are you hoping that we'll leave? That the Castilian people will rise up against us?... Or perhaps Aquitaine will come to your rescue. You must know how likely that may be. Your regime's debauchery made certain the Castilian people will favour their new Royal Family."
15533221111211.title: Ferdinand of Trastámara is brought before Empre...

155332211112111.content:
"A Trastámara would never kowtow the she-wolf usurper and her puppet King" Ferdinand said venomously.

Mary smirked in response Ferdinand's angry retort. "On the contrary, many already have. Your uncle in particular was keen to preserve his expensive lifestyle."

"We've decided to keep him around" Edward added, "if you continue to prove uncooperative he may yet be of use to us."

"That man called himself King, he betrayed my grandfather." Ferdinand shouted. "and he betrayed his country. Your deluded if you think I'll betray Castile and bow down to you!"

"Take him away" Mary said to Edward's guards, before she turned to talk to Edward himself "Should he fail to submit by the end of the week, I want him transferred to Rochester."

"As you wish, your Imperial Majesty"

"It would be foolish to martyr him, and it's will become to dangerous to keep him here." She added after he was out of the room, "should he submit then he must declare so in front of the people of Jaca; after which you will kill his uncle"

"As you say"
155332211112111.title: He speaks.

choices: Ferdinand of Trastámara requests an audience with Edward.
1553322111121111.content:
"A shame that the Empress couldn't join us for lunch, your Majesty" Duchess Katherine said.

"Indeed, though I fear the war with Aquitaine took her else where" Edward couldn't see why it mattered to her, she spent more time with her during her visit than he himself did. Clearly the fact she turned down the offer of lunch was not a snub to Katherine indicating that she was no longer her mouthpiece.

"Empress Mary doesn't see an end to the war in the sight" Katherine acknowledged.

"I think we're going to just have to resign ourselves to the Aquitaine pretenders in the north"

"Perhaps..." she replied non-committally, "though should we assassinate their King in north, there by exposing the weakness of the Aquitaine regime the resistance they might pose will be lessened."

"I don't believe that death is the answer" Edward insisted, "we should seek peace"

"The Empress disagrees. The Aquitaine invasion of Castile was a desperate attempt by King Laurence to hold onto his throne, the bluff can't sustain it's self for long. The more we push, the weaker it gets."

"Aquitaine outnumbers us more than two to one, how would would you envisage a full scale invasion ending?" Edward asked.

"That is why we must outmanoeuvre them, use subterfuge and tricks." She replied. "I don't believe that weak King Laurence has the will or confidence to order an invasion that could potentially be suicidal to him. Besides plans have already been formulated theorising anything Aquitaine could do. I can't imagine we'll be caught off guard"

Duchess Katherine was confident that her opinions were right, and she was a clever women, Edward couldn't doubt that she had a point but overconfidence too was a foolish stance. "I will consider what you have said"

"Very good, your Majesty. With your permission I will take my leave" Katherine stood before he granted the answer she knew she could be getting.

"Of course, my lady." With Katherine present his lunch had been extremely unrelaxing, Edward was in no doubt that the discussion was truly Katherine's way of giving her advice and orders to him, and though he was King he didn't consider it wise to argue with her. For all her faults Edward sensed her allegiance was fully to Mercia and Mary, and that she wasn't playing a power game. Katherine was one person that made the southern Castile regime stronger than the northern one, and Edward wasn't willing to weaken it for vanities sake.

After a few moments Edward shook his hand, indicating that he wanted the empty plates taken away. While he was at it he ordered more food to be bought to him, the stress of working lunch is hardly helps the appetite. Even before he'd arrived in Jaca, Edward disliked Castilian food, he considered it too exotic, and without supplies from Mercia his court had settled on eating Aquitaine style foods, which wasn't so bad. Other than the meats, fish and bread, pastries, and cakes were the foods most commonly served food, and they were all among his favorite. As disdainful as basking in Aquitaine culture, Edward found it unavoidable when it came to food, especially when he was so far from home.
1553322111121111.title: Edward having lunch.

choices: Later that day, as he's about to go to bed.
15533221111211111.content:
As Edward placed the last bit of lunch, the end of the slice of a slice of lemon cake into his mouth he felt his stomach rumble. He had already eaten some meat and fish dishes, two pastries and a large slice of cake, he was surprised that he was still hungry. It was probably the sight of a delicious looking tiered chocolate gateau that he'd noticed as he polished off the lemon cake. He clicked his figure in the air and a servant took away his plates and another replaced it with a large slice of the chocolate gateau with a jug of double cream, the slice was larger than he'd wanted, but he wasn't going to complain.

"Ah that was good" Edward said to himself under his breath as he mopped up the end of the cream with the last piece of cake. He felt slightly sick, the gateau was rich enough as it was, the cream had just made it even richer. He'd enjoyed every bit all the same. He lent back casually on his chair and placed his hand on his bloated stomach.
15533221111211111.title: Edward decides to have thirds.

155332211112111111.content:
Edward had just got changed for bed, he wished to god that he could sleep in just his underwear - but that was to 'Castilian' apparently. So he was dressed in elaborate pajamas, the sort that of which were high fashion back in Rochester. They were hell in this heat though. He even had to put on the bed 'hat' that went with it, he felt way over dressed for bed.

"Your Majesty" Said one of his advisers who had just entered the room.

"Yes" Edward replied, with an irritable tone in his voice.

"Ferdinand of Trastámara has requested an audience with you."

"Really?" Edward was shocked, Ferdinand hadn't once acknowledged him, and it didn't as if was going to. "Did he say what he wanted?"

"No, I'm afraid not sire. He just said that he wished to speak with you"

"Hmmm... I hope he's not just wasting my time. I must go and see him though. At once." Edward said, heading to the door with haste, "where is he being held?"

"In the spire... the Guards outside will show you the way." The advisor said as he opened and then moved out of the way of the door.

"I appreciate it."
155332211112111111.title: Later that day, as he's about to go to bed.

choices: Ferdinand turns down Mary and Edward's offer.
Edward considers Mary and Edward's offer.
1553322111121111111.content:
It took Edward about twenty minuets to reach Ferdinand's Prison Chambers in the Jaca Spire, he was going to be frustrated should it end up being a waste of time. He was tired as it was, and he certainly wasn't as fit as he perhaps should be. Walking briskly for forty minuets in that unbearable eventing heat wasn't something he wanted to do often.

"He's just in there Your Majesty" The lead guard said, pointing at the isolated door at the end of the corridor.

"Thanks" Edward said as he patted the guard appreciatively on the shoulder.

The guard stepped in the chamber first, it wasn't what Edward was expecting - far more luxurious, and not prison like at all. Though he had ruled that Ferdinand was treated honourably, this must be how the Castilian treat their more privileged prisoners. Ferdinand was sat on a large chair facing the window, to the left of him was a small table and on the other side another large chair. The room also featured a good quality four poster bed, a large desk, a dinner table and a fire place. And the window a view of the entire city of Jaca.

"I will speak to King Edward alone" Ferdinand said dryly.

Edward nodded at the guard who handed him a dagger, and left the room closing the door behind him.

"Not too bad... for a prison cell" Edward commented. He placed the sheaved dagger in one of the Pyjama trouser pockets, and stepped further into the room, so that he was standing only a few metres away from Ferdinand, who had his back Edward as he gazed out of the high rise window.

"Still a cell" Ferdinand responded, captivity isn't all it's cracked up to be.

"It's better than being without a head" Edward pointed out.

"I suppose so... marginally." Ferdinand replied with a smirk on his face.

"... So. What is it you wanted?" Edward asked.

"To talk." Ferdinand said.

"Is that it?" Edward said in annoyance.

"Why not?... I haven't spoken to anyone, beside your... what sister? Aunt?"

"Cousin" Edward crossed his arms. "Any chance you've considered her offer"

"Her offer? I thought it was your offer" Ferdinand smirked again as he caught Edward out.

"Err, well... it's the offer of the House of York" Edward said in quick thinking.

"Oh I see" Ferdinand nodded.

It was just now that Edward was realising just how infuriating Ferdinand was, he should have known based on the what people said at court.

"This was ours for a millennia" Ferdinand stood up and raised his arms as he started deeply out of the window at Jaca. Edward couldn't help but notice that Ferdinand wasn't wearing a shirt, he couldn't see the bottoms but I guessed they were just underwear. It seemed his advisor and courtiers were right, if he wore what he wanted then he'd be wearing what the Trastámara pretender was wearing. It didn't matter an awful lot, but clothes were in a way as symbolic as a flag or coat of arms, they displayed your allegiance, your wealth or your mood. It wouldn't be proper for a Yorkist King dressing as the Trastámara's did, especially after they expressed the the depravity as well as the apparent inferiority of the former ruling house. "And now foreigners divide our land and place their own puppets on our throne."
1553322111121111111.title: At Ferdinand's prison chambers.

choices: Leaves and returns to his bed chamber.
15533221111211111112.content:
"When we came your regime was corrupt to the core, your poor were had become so downtrodden that they were dying by hundreds, and all the while the rich sat by and let it happen." Edward retorted.

"Mercia has it's poor too" Ferdinand said sharply, sitting back down on to his chair.

"Not to this extent, they aren't homeless, they aren't starving." Edward pointed out.

"Perhaps" Ferdinand said without remorse. "But would you kowtow to usurpers?.. bow down to barbarians from the North?"

"Barbarians" Edward snorted.

"Okay, perhaps that was a little too harsh." Ferdinand conceded.

Edward smiled sympathetically, he wasn't without feeling for Ferdinand and House of Trastámara's fallen position, but his loyalty to Mary, the House of York and the Kingdom of Mercia were paramount, and he wouldn't be shaken on them. "I might remind you that It was I who made sure that your imprisonment was comfortable... that you were treated as a guest, and not a prisoner."

"And for that you have my gratitude." Ferdinand rose once again, and walked from the chair so that he was facing Edward. "Truly" he added with a cheeky smile.

Edward was glad that Ferdinand not only recognised that fact, but appreciated too.

As he guessed Ferdinand was dressed only in underwear, and they were far more skimpy than anything he had considered. They covered none of his legs, only his bum and genitalia. But Edward's eyes quickly were drawn to Ferdinand's torso, which was incredibly toned. His abs were well defined, and he appeared quite strong and athletic. Edward couldn't believe it. He'd heard that Ferdinand had been thin and lanky as a child, but became quite pudgy as a teenager. Clearly life on the run, and now in imprisonment had forced Ferdinand to getting into shape, but he was shocked to the extent. All of a sudden he felt quite self concious, he realised how soft his stomach had become... how soft it had always been to be perfectly honest. He'd never been skinny, even as a child.

"But that doesn't mean I appreciate my current predicament" Ferdinand continued, he stepped backwards and perched on the edge of his bed. "Our first and only Queen was sent here after she failed to keep the throne, eventually she lost her head. Her sacred position didn't save her."

"We won't kill you. It wouldn't be in our interest... to make a martyr of you." Edward promised. To his dismay, his eyes were once again drawn to Ferdinand's naked torso. He still just couldn't believe how toned Ferdinand was, even seated Edward could see no body fat at all, he on the other hand was all to aware of his own stomach protruding over his waist when seated. More worryingly for Edward, he was turned on by Ferdinand; he could feel that he had an erection, fortunately the pajamas hid it, but it was seriously disturbing that he found a guy attractive, and a Castilian prince of all people.
15533221111211111112.title: Edward considers Mary and Edward's offer.

155332211112111111121.content:
"So do you have an answer.. or not" Edward insisted.

"Let's just say I'm considering it... shall we." Ferdinand smirked again, "perhaps then I'll warrant another late knight visit from our usurper king."

"I wouldn't count on it" Edward replied sheepishly.

"I think so. Especially when there's a chance I might yield" Ferdinand pointed out, "Plus you'll get to see me again... and something tells me that you want to"

"I will admit, there is something intriguing about you." Edward accepted, "Think it over. Very carefully." He turned before Ferdinand could say another word, and the guard opened the door for him and shut it after him.

It took Edward and his entourage about half an hour to arrive back at his bed chamber, they'd walked at a far slower pace heading back as there wasn't such a need to rush. Fortunately the sun had gone down and it had gotten far cooler. Though still by the time he reached his room and he'd dismissed his guards, Edward was shattered, he far tireder than he ought to be. He hadn't realised just how unfit he'd become. It wasn't as if he'd run gone on long walks or run marathons back in Mercia, but he certainly hadn't got so tired after two walks that took about an hour between them. It was true it was far cooler back in Mercia, a far better climate for that sort of thing in his opinion; though that had never spired him into exercise as a child, he'd always preferred reading and other indoor activities that didn't require much energy. No wonder he'd had a pudgy stomach all his life.

He crawled into his bed and took a deep breath, before turning over and going to sleep.
155332211112111111121.title: Leaves and returns to his bed chamber.

choices: He decides to exercise in the morning.
1553322111121111111212.content:
Edward awoke at gone two in the morning, his stomach was growling so loudly that he had been unable to remain asleep. "God what time is it" he muttered to himself before catching a glimpse of the large clock at the far end of the room. Once again his stomach rumbled and he quickly placed his hand to try and calm it.

After a few minuets of pondering as to whether he'd grab a snack or just try and get back to sleep he decided that he would, he was never going to sleep while he was so hungry. He crept to his personal cupboard which was stocked with food for his personal convenience, he grabbed a tin which was full of giant cookies that had been baked earlier in the day and took it back to bed. They were delicious, though he'd taken two out to have then and placed the tin to one side, soon enough he returned to the tin to get out an additional cookie along with his book.

For half an hour he read his book, and snacked on the cookies in complete peace. It was so relaxing in comparison to the other events of the day. As he became full up, Edward decided to go back to sleep. He dropped his book back on his bedside table, and placed the lid back on the tin off cookies. There were only three left, had he really eaten almost an entire tin? That must have been over ten cookies. He was sure it had been full when he'd started, perhaps not after all. As he slouched down into bed and lent onto one side he could feel that his stomach had become quite hard and bloated in the process of his snack. No doubt he was going to have to cut down on what he ate, he couldn't afford to get any more unfit that he already was.
1553322111121111111212.title: Midnight snack.

15533221111211111112121.content:
Edward woke up late in morning, he still felt rather heavy from the night before, and he couldn't bring himself to get straight out of bed. He guessed that his servants had probably been in to see if he was awake already, likely several times. By now breakfast time will have already came and happened, it wouldn't be long until lunch was served. Based on his thoughts when he finally went to sleep last night, missing breakfast might not be such a bad thing.

After remaining in bed for a further fifteen minuets, Edward finally decided to get up and get on with the day. He dressed plainly, in a light outfit consisting of only trousers and a shirt. He was tempted not to wear a headpiece, but opted to as his dress was Castilian enough as it was. Once he was fully ready he left his bed chambers and made his way to palace's gymnasium.
15533221111211111112121.title: He decides to exercise in the morning.

155332211112111111121211.content:
Upon reaching the gymnasium, Edward couldn't not notice how deserted it was. Almost every other wing of the palace was bustling, it was true that the Mercian aristocracy probably numbered less than half than the Castilians they replaced. But had never appeared that way, until now. The facilities were great, top of the line, it was surprising that more courtiers didn't want to make use of it. He looked around, at the massive swimming pool, the running track, the wrestling ring, the weights and the fencing ring. There was plenty of choice, obviously he couldn't wrestle of fence without a partner, or an instructor. He hadn't bought swimming gear, so if he did that he'd have do to it naked. In the end he opted to jog round the track, while the weight lifting could... would have been useful, he didn't want to strain anything by doing it uninstructed.

Edward spent a few minuets doing his warm up stretches and then stepped onto the track, he started at a reasonably slow pace, going to fast to quick wasn't going to help him get fit any quicker. The young King set off and instantly made good time as he completed one lap, and without feeling tired or out of breath at all.
155332211112111111121211.title: Decided to jog.

choices: Go back to his room and change before lunch.
1553322111121111111212111.content:
Edward's good work didn't last quite as long as he hoped, he hadn't even reached the end of his second lap before he began to tire and breath heavily. At that point he slowed down a fair bit in order to pace himself better, by the time the end of the third lap was in sight he slowed down to a pace barely faster than a walk. He managed to reach just over half way around the third lap before he was so tired, hot and out of breath that he had to stop. It was very frustrating, he'd only been at it for about twenty minuets, probably less. He'd thought he'd at least complete an hour, hoped for two, of assorted exercise before he stopped. He lay down here he stood, as he continued to breath very heavily. He certainly couldn't do anything else, he wouldn't last a minuet doing weights in this condition, while swimming might help him cool down he felt to tired to even move. It was a good job that nobody had witnessed his 'failure' of exercise, he'd have never lived it down.

He slowly rose to his feet and headed for one of the changing rooms. He was so puffed out that it took him almost five minuets to reach it. Edward almost breathed a sigh of relief when he sat down once again, after a couple of minuets he stripped off his sweaty clothes and stepped under the shower. They were among the things he liked about Castile, the climate assure that the water was a warm temperature, a reason why people favoured bathes back in Mercia.

By the time he stepped out of the shower, dried himself and put back on his sweaty clothes he felt allot better, though not really up to more exercise.
1553322111121111111212111.title: Three and half laps later.

15533221111211111112121111.content:
As Edward passed the weights, he considered doing some lifting before he went up to get changed but ultimately chose to leave it for the day. He was still feeling strained enough as it was, he didn't want to ache for days for the sake of what would likely have only been less than ten minuets weight lifting.

He was relived to be able to strip of the sweaty athletic clothes he'd been wearing, though what replaced them were not more comfortable - quite the opposite, they were hotter, heavier and over elaborate. It also meant that he could go and get something to eat, it was early afternoon and he hadn't eaten a thing all day, as he'd been walking back to his bed chamber he'd felt his stomach rumble uncontrollable. Yes he was trying to eat less all for the sake of his physique, but it left him feeling starving. Perhaps that was why his exercise hadn't been quite as predictive as he'd hoped.

"Your Majesty" A young Castilian man said in a thick local accent. It was one of his personal quarters servants.

Edward smiled, signalling that he could could cease bowing.

"Where will you take lunch?"
15533221111211111112121111.title: Go back to his room and change before lunch.

155332211112111111121211111.content:
"It's such a lovely afternoon, I think I'll take it on the terrace" Edward peered out of the window at the sea glistening in the sun light. It was always a shame to be in on days like this, not that they were a rarity here in Castile.

"Of course your Majesty"

He was lead across to his private balcony in which he could see the great palace gardens, and beyond that much of Jaca and it's beautiful beach. Edward placed his order, though being the same as everyday it came so quickly that he assumed it was prepared with the presumption that he'd be having it yet again. He started with simple bread, cheese and butter, until they bought out the soup and meat which he dug into heartedly. Just the smell had made him all the more hungry, he was relived that his stomach had at last stopped rumbling. Once the young King had finished that course he knew the next was his favorite, it included the sweet dishes. His servants bought through an assortment of pastries, cakes and biscuits. He was spoilt for choice, or at least he would have been had he not finished everything, as he initially assumed he wouldn't. They'd bought individual cupcakes, chocolate gateaux, lemon cake, shortbread, éclairs. It really should have been a far too much for someone of Edwards size to eat. But they were his all time favorite foods, as he had tried one dish, he had do try another. Despite feeling full to bursting, Edward continued to softly place the last of the chocolate gateaux into his mouth.

"That was great", he said to himself under his breath. After it appeared that the servants were going to come and clear up, Edward got up and headed back to his bed chambers to relax before he had to attend court this afternoon. He walked almost as slowly as he had in the morning after exercising. Upon reaching his room he climbed onto his bed and let out a sigh of relaxation. So much for starting to cut down on what he ate, he so bloated that he was forced to unbutton his jerkin to feel comfortable, as it had constrained his rounded stomach When it came lose he decided to remove it completely and just though it to the floor. Edward yawned, he was having trouble staying awake. He had heard this civil servant going on about budgets, fishery quoters and trading regulations for nearly half an hour now. He barely understood a word of it, though fortunately it wasn't his job to do so, various members of the privy council were responsible for dealing with finance, bureaucracy and regulations on his behalf.

"Thank you, my lord" Duchess Katherine at last said, she had a real knack for politely shutting people up without seeming to inflict any offence, "these matters will be dealt with when the council is next in session".

"Th..thank you your Grace" He bowed respectfully to her before turning and performing a low bow to him, "your majesty".

Edward nodded his head at him, and he moved to the side so that another official could receive an audience with the throne and the council, "who's next."

"General, Lord Hague, your majesty" Duchess Katherine said as she ushered the military commander forward with her hand.

"What do you have to report, General?" Edward asked. With a bit of luck this would be more interesting than the previous report.

"Our scouts report troubling news about an army assembling against us in the south west" he said calmly.

"Really?" Edward sat forward in interest, "do we know who it is? who's leading them?"

"We can't say for certain, but our intel suggests that it's the Castilian resistance - or the Royal Castilian Army as they still like to be know. If that is the case, they are being lead by the Viscount of Saragossa, Felipe de Trastámara. He is the son of the Duke of Aragon, who was transported to Mercia on Empress Mary's orders."

"What is being done about it..." Duchess Katherine demanded, "forces must be sent to meet them"

"Based on their location it is entirely possible they are planning a forced march to the Ciudad Rodrigo Fortress, a key strategic point on the western coast that would give them access to the sea. Or another part of Aquitaine held territory. I fear that should we rush to engage them that we would not win, we simply don't have enough soldiers. And doing so would alert them to the presence of our spies."

"What if they are to attack Jaca?" Edward asked.

"If we assembled a force on route, we could attempt to delay them while we wait for re-enforcements."

"Only a delay?" Edward replied with disappointment in his voice.

"If that is the case then Ferdinand of Trastámara should be moved from the city as soon as possible." Katherine said.

"The Duke of Aragon is one of the key claimants to the throne, and without him Felipe de Trastámara, as Crown Prince, will surely be intending to serve as regent. I can't imagne that they'll seek to 'liberate' him" one of the other councillors said scornfully.

"They may seek to harm him.. quite possibly kill him." Katherine pointed out, "while it would be a difficult argument, they could then try and pin it on us"

"I agree with the Duchess" Edward quickly added, "he should be moved at the next best opportunity."

"Dreadnought Ark Royal is three miles off the coast of Jaca. He would be secure there." the general suggested. "As would senior members of court, when and if necessary"

"Yes your majesty. We can have an armed guard move him by noon tomorrow"

15533221111211111112121111121.content:
The session of court went on longer than usual, more discussions had been necessary about the possibility of a battle with the Viscount of Saragossa, and by the time dinner was over it was gone half nine before Ferdinand got any free time. As soon as the decision to move Ferdinand of Trastámara came up, Edward had in it his mind that he would make a second visit, perhaps a final visit, to the deposed Prince. There was still useful information that he could give them, and based on how difficult it was to get him to talk Edward couldn't see him giving such information to anybody else. Beyond that Edward was intrigued by him. Ever since the first visit, Edward had been considering excuses to use to visit him once again. Though he was doing all he could to deny such reasoning to himself.

It was another warm night, and though the walk seemed to take for ever they made it there in less than twenty minutes. When Edward and his guards approached the door, they repeated the drill from the previous visit and waited outside, after they had opened and closed the door for him.

"I hoped you'd come visit me again" Ferdinand said to Edward in his seductive Castilian accent.

Unlike last time Ferdinand rose to his feet immediately and offered Edward a seat next to the window. To Edward's disappointment he was fully dressed this time, well by Castilian standards anyway. He was wearing a light looking pair of short trousers, leather sandal like shoes, and a thin satin vest. "I assume you were informed that you were to be moved from here in the coming days"

"Come to say goodbye?" He asked.

"You didn't answer my question" Edward protested.

"Nor you mine..." he added cheekily.

"I asked first" Edward said starting to sound exasperated.

"Hahaha" Ferdinand laughed, "you're so cute."

Edward resisted smiling, though he wasn't able to stop himself from blushing, "you still haven't answered..."

"Okay okay... yes, I was told. Taking me somewhere nice?"

"You'll be moved to the dreadnought Ark Royal."

"Wow, I've never been on a battleship before"

"It's not going to be a pleasure trip. You're being taken there for your own security" Edward explained, he felt compelled to inform him of this fact and not only because of how quickly he became exasperated of Ferdinand's responses to his questions.

"Aww shame" he replied, completely unphased by the mentioning of the fact that his life could be in danger. "Can't be worse than this... at least I'll get some fresh air"

"I imagine that you'll disagree once you've spent a day on board" Edward couldn't resist smiling that time.

"Sooo... back to my question." Ferdinand said quickly, changing the subject, "did you come here to say good bye?"

"Nn..no of course not" Edward quavered.

"Hmmm, so you only came to ask me if I knew I was being moved... that's not the job of a great King.. usuper or no... now is it?" Ferdinand asserted with a big grin on his face.

"I had other questions" Edward insisted, "what do you know of Felipe of Sargossa?"

"He's my first cousin"

"Very helpful" Edward said sarcastically, "anything else?"

"His father... my uncle, tried to claim my throne when King Philip died. I expect he would have succeeded to had you northern bastards not launched simultaneous invasions." Ferdinand explained, his tone was noticeably more serious know. Edward was surprised about how candid he was being, openly admitted that he thought it uncle would succeed in taking his throne.

"What? You agree that your uncle could have won?" Edward was shocked.

"Of course. Why not?" Ferdinand smiled, "he had more men than me, he was more popular and would have made a far better king. And it's not as if I wanted to be king anyway, had it been my choice I would have just given him the throne... but my branch of the House wouldn't allow it."

"Oh?" Edward said, lacking any other response to the surprising explanation.

"And cousin Felipe?... He's an Infante of Castile, Viscount of Sargossa and future Duke of Aragon. Had uncle succeeded he would also be crown prince and the future King. He might yet be. Has he assembled an army against you?"

"You could say that" Edward answered, it was no use lying. The information though sensitive was no use to Ferdinand, who was he going to tell? And it wasn't as if Felipe was an ally of his.

"And that's why you're moving me. Your already expecting to lose the battle, and with uncle dead or missing, he could be King very soon indeed."

"The Duke of Aragon isn't dead... or missing. We know exactly where he is"

"He's a fellow prisoner?" Ferdinand said joyfully, "some good news at least"

"And even if we should lose the battle against him, it doesn't mean we're planing on abandoning Castile. Besides with us gone, Aquitaine will have nothing stopping them from taking the entire country. Your cousin could do little to stop that"

"A fair point" Ferdinand said, "though isn't Aquitaine a greater enemy of yours than we are? That point would be bad for both of us."

"I did say we weren't planning on abandoning Castile" Edward reiterated.

"Yes... of course. Well I'm sorry, but there's very little else I can tell you about cousin Felipe. He's a good tactician.... he's tall, dark and handsome."

Before lunch Edward had returned to his chambers to change, he opted for a light vest, without the usual shirt underneath, and trousers, both were simple, cool and elaborate, perfect for this hot weather, as was his unusual decision not to wear sleeves.

Edward sat down on his private balcony, the servants had already brought out lunch in anticipation of his imminent arrival. After the pleasure of the previous night, he knew he should be feeling great, but somehow he was feeling depressed. Now Ferdinand was gone, and what's the chances of him remembering Edward? It was said that the promiscuous Prince 'shagged what ever he wanted' an unkind rumour that did not cease when the Castilian courtiers fled. It's one of various topics of discussion doing the rounds among the current Mercian courtiers.

Edward took a large bite into a barbecued chicken leg as he gazed our to sea, the Ark Royal was well in view from his balcony, Ferdinand would on board by now, perhaps in the brig if he was unlucky. It was occurring to Edward that his mind may have put an overly romantic spin on his 'forbidden love of two princes', especially when one prince is probably moving onto the next man of women. All over the the continent the act lying with another man considered sinful, regardless of the fact that people who commit the act are never punished, Ferdinand was one of many throughout history, to do it openly, before the fall of Castile that was.

As they placed the assortment of deserts on the table in front of him, Edward quickly chomped down the rest of his current course. For desert they had brought him, cakes and pastries, as usual, but also ice cream, sweets and chocolate. The warmth demanded that he started with the ice cream, before it melted. It was thick, creamy and delicious. A sentiment he shared with the cakes, chocolate and the rest, which he proceeded to eat with tremendous enthusiasm.

Unavoidable Edward burped, though he managed to hide it from the servants. After he had taken the last bite of cake he could manage, he singled to them to clear the table. He undid the two lower buttons on his vest, and the upper button on his trousers, to loosen them for his bloated stomach so that he was more comfortable. After which he breathed calmly as he was relieved of the strain, and lifted his legs onto the table and placed his head back onto the chair and began to doze off.

Jaca was in chaos, Edward could see the smoke of war from the palace. The forces of the Viscount de Saragossa had breached the city walls with a force that outnumbered the Mercians five-to-one. Many courtiers had already fled, the wiser had been evacuated to waiting Mercian battleships. Advisers had insisted that Edward and the Privy Council be evacuated first, but he had insisted that as King he must remain as long as possible, or look weak. To Edward's amazement Duchess Katherine had agreed, and still remained in the palace with him.

"Your Majesty" Katherine walked gracefully into Edward's chambers, "if we are to leave the Palace, it must be now."

"Very well" Edward replied, "have we revived any reply from Rochester?"

"I'm afraid not sire, most occupational documents have already been removed, if a message had been revived I fear that they would have destroyed it to prevent the enemy from getting there hands on it" Katherine explained. The two left his chambers and headed down a corridor to a long flight of stairs that would lead to the court yard, with a waiting transport to take them to the Ark Royal.

"Your Majesty, Your Grace" an officer said to Edward and Katherine as they exited the Palace onto the courtyard. "these carriages will take you to the dock where a ship is waiting to evacuate you to the ark royal."

"What's the status of the enemy" Katherine stopped and asked as Edward stepped into is carriage.

"They say that they are racing to the palace" another officer chipped in.

"You have served your King and your Empress well, you will be honoured and rewarded whether you live or die" Katherine promised kindly as she left to get into her carriage, the second she was in the convoy galloped out of the palace in the direction of the docks.

15533221111211111112121111121221122.content:
Edward tripped forward onto the floor of the carriage, there had been a crash or something. He looked out the window at Katharine's carriage which had also stopped.

"Your Majesty" One Guard said as he flung open the carriage door. "There has been an ambush, we must get you and the Duchess to safety"

Edward looked behind him at his forces that had engaged with those who had ambushed them, to Edwards untrained eye they didn't look like soldiers, and were being roundly beaten by the elite of the Mercian Royal Guard. He turned his head to Katherine's carriage where she was also being ushered out.

"The dock is around about a mile from here, we must to the rest on foot" he added.

"Let's go" Katherine said to Edward with urgency in her voice.

She Edward and two escort Guards headed from the fray toward a clearing that would eventually lead them to the dock.

"Ah" one guard gurgled, seconds later similar noises came from the other and they fell to the floor, both with arrows through their heads.

"Oh my god, oh my god" Edward said in panic.

"They're dead, we've got to go" Katherine insisted.

Edward could only think about the two dead guards, and the seemingly futile escape.

"Edward" she said sternly, "we can morn those who died later. We've got to leave.. NOW"

"O...okay" He replied, following Katherine down an ally.

They stopped as they neared the end, it didn't seem as if any of the enemy were close to them, but they could never be sure.

"We should split up" Katherine said, "we can't allow them to catch both of us together."

"Okay" Edward agreed, her priority of her own importance might seem like self adulation, but it was pragmatism. She was one of the most senior people at Court and in a very real way, the most powerful.

"See you on the Ark Royal sire"

"And you your grace"

And with that the two departed, Katherine headed down the road and Edward followed the route to another narrow ally. It was a good job the city was deserted in the wake of the attack, their elaborate Mercian dress, not to mention their pale skin, would and will stand out like a sore thumb. Native Castilians might turn them in for a reward.

-----

Edward stopped for a breather as he had been almost constantly running for an hour. Surely he was nearing the dock by now. His heart had never belated so fast, he couldn't know how much further he could physically go. It was certainly true that he should have been fit and in shape, like Ferdinand was when he was on the run. Edward was exhausted beyond measure, all those years of lack of exercise were now paying there toll. And if he died, or was captured that would be the reason.

Fortunately Edward found the energy to go on, he was running of adrenalin now. After another forty five minuets he finally reached the dock where two guards were standing beside a boat that would take him to the Ark Royal.

The uniform felt and looked great on him, the only trouble was that it was too small. Edward had had a lot of trouble fastening the trouser button but had eventually succeeded despite the discomfort. While the shirt, and jacket had fitted just fight, he had far greater trouble getting the belt around them. The golden sash was suppose to go around his waist, just where his belly button was. But it wasn't designed to be tied, like the trousers it's fastening had only one setting; it was fortunate that his dinner had all gone down after the nap, because to get it on in the right place he had to breath in allot. Once he was dressed he looked at himself in the mirror and he was pleased with the result, it didn't look at all tight on him, no more than it was suppose to appear fitted. Perhaps that's why it was so tight?

After taking a few moments to get use to the binding tightness of the uniform, he left his quarters and headed over to the Admiral's office to meet with him, and Duchess Katherine.

-----

"Your Majesty" The Admiral said to Edward upon him entering the office.

Edward smiled back at him, and took a seat beside Katherine, who looked surprisingly well for someone who was injured.

"It's good to see you sire" Katherine said, "the Admiral and myself were discussing measures that will be taken against the invaders."

"Any more news from Jaca" Edward asked.

"Yes." Katherine started, "Fellepie Trastámara has reached the palace and taken up residence, while we had expected him to declare himself Regent he has gone one step further..."

"King?" Edward interrupted.

"Indeed" Katherine continued, "he has declared himself King of Castile, explaining that with the disappearance, or death, of his father he was better placed sitting on the throne himself, rather than keeping it warm. And he's right. The people are more likely to rally to their King, rather than the boy-regent of an absent or dead man."

"We can't afford to wait for him to make another move" the Admiral said sternly. "With him as a King holding the capital, the resistance ceases to exist and becomes a legitimate government... it will give his soldiers have confidence, and more will join him. He'll sweep across southern Castile and wipe out our entire presence, and I fear we will then be unable to ever take it back."

"Certainly not should Aquitaine then do the strategic obvious. Fellipe must realise that southern Castile would be so weak that Aqutiaine would be able to take it with him unable to do anything about it?" Katherine asked.

"I would have thought so... he might be hoping that once he proves that not only can we be defied, but beaten that so can the Aqutianie occupiers." the Admiral replied.

"Hmmm" Edward replied thoughtfully trying to take it all in.

"Regardless of holding the city, Felipe doesn't control the sea... that is still ours. I would suggest bombarding the city into submission." Katherine said bluntly, "should he refuse we can then make our counter invasion."

"That's if the so called 'Lord of the High Seas' doesn't interfere" Edward pointed out.

"While his ships are inferior, and his strategy sporadic, it would be foolish to discount him as a threat." the Admiral agreed.

"They are arrogant... When we first launched our invasion they warned us that the seas of Castile belonged to them, and they would not tolerate our presence there... there ships were torn apart as they attacked the fleet as if it was trading vessel. His strategy may well have changed, but i can't see that it's going to be that much difficult to defeat them."

The discussions went on, for well over an hour. Edward only chipped in every now and then, he only had to make a choice based on their recommendations. Military strategy wasn't his talent, he was impressed by Katherine's knowledge though. When the discussions finally came to a close they decided to sleep on it and make the final decision in the morning. The assault couldn't take place until tomorrow at the earliest, it was best to leave things open when events were so fluid.

1553322111121111111212111112122112211211.content:
Edward followed the stairs down from the Admiral's office, back towards his personal quarters. As he made his way down the corridor he saw an officer obstructing his path, Edward's heard started beating as he suspected it wasn't' a good thing, and he looked fairly intimidating. He stayed his path and walked directly towards the officer, avoiding eye contact fervently. To his relief the officer bowed honourably.

"Your Royal Majesty" he said, "I'm Commandant Evans, Head of the Jaca Prison service"

"What can I do for you Commandant" Edward asked.

"Ferdinand of Trastámara has requested an audience with your Majesty"

"Oh" Edward said trying not to sound to excited, "did he say what he wanted?"

"No, your Majesty. He said that you'd know." Commandant Evans explained.

"Really?... how does he even know I'm on board?" Edward persisted, he didn't want to sound to enthusiastic about seeing Ferdinand. Though he was curious all the same, Ferdinand was surprisingly well informed.

"I...I couldn't say for sure Your Majesty." Evans hesitated, "I'm confidant that nobody has informed him of the fact. He may have guessed from how busy the the ship had been of late"

That was entirely possible, Edward had been moved to the Ark Royal to protect him from Felipe of Trastámara, it's only natural to assume that if they were right about Felipe that Edward and his court would be next to leave the city. Whether a lucky guess, or pragmatic assumption, Ferdinand was right and Edward was going to have to decide whether to deny him an audience or not.

"When he requested an audience, we denied the fact you were on board. He's asked several times now, whether he think's we've asked or not is unclear" Evans elaborated.

"Very well Commandant" Edward started.

1553322111121111111212111112122112211211.content:
"Very well Commandant" Edward started, "I shall go and see him"

"I would recommend not.... your Majesty" Commandant Evans objected.

"Why not?" Edward cautiously asked .

"I'm sorry your Majesty. I meant to say that you should not visit his cell. While he has been confined in one of the ships nicer cells, it's a comparative description.. I would advise that it's certainly no place for a king."

"Oh?" Edward was relived, he had thought the Commandant was opposing him visiting Ferdinand. "Where shall I see him?"

"It's hard to say your majesty. This is an active war ship, not a prison... and your not exactly the average visitor."

"Bring him to my quarters." Edward commanded, "make sure that a security are present at both exits."

"As you wish, your Majesty" And with that Commandant Evans left.

1553322111121111111212111112122112211211.content:
It only took Ferdinand a few minuets to get back to his quarters, they were in the same part of the ship as the Admiral's office. With a bit of luck he would have time to change from his uncomfortable military uniform before Ferdinand was brought to him.

After only about thirty seconds he spent selecting clothes to put on he heard a loud knock on the door, obviously he wouldn't have time to change. "Yes" He shouted.

The door flung open and one of his Royal Guardsmen stepped in, "The commandant has brought the Trastámara boy, will you see him now"

Edward stepped speedily across the room and sat down on his chair, "thank you... bring him in."

"Your Majesty" Ferdinand said, like last time he gave a somewhat sarcastic bow.

"You wished to see me." Edward said, he nodded to the Guardsmen indicating that he should leave.

"So.. you fled from Jaca I see... my cousin must have been successful" Ferdinand said, as he wandered around the quarters nosily examining the ornaments and décor.

"Clearly so" Edward replied, "he has declared himself King ahead of his father, and has already executed many of my courtiers who weren't able to flee in time."

"Really?" Ferdinand was intrigued, he turned away from a golden clock he was looking at to face Edward, "I never thought he was so ambitious. I never realised your hold over Jaca was so weak."

"We'll retake the city soon enough... you may be reunited with your cousin if your lucky" Edward smiled.

"Perhaps you will... Castile doesn't have any vessels as impressive as this, I could see even the great 'Lord of the High Seas' falling before this ship."

"He died when we first invaded, hopefully his successor has more sense than to attack an elite warship."

"Isn't the irony beautiful, you and your fleet sit of the port of Jaca... and you haven't the men to take the city back. Cousin Felipe holds the city of Jaca and is unable to attack you. Seems your at an impasse."

"Not if..." Edward started.

"..you bombard the city?" Ferdinand asked with a smirk on his face. "You hope to bomb my cousin into submission?"

"You have doubts about it working?" Edward replied, evading the question. "It is Duchess Katherine herself's strategy"

"Ah yes.. Duchess Katherine. Your cousin... sister" he corrected himself, "...Mary, she hasn't yet chosen a wife for you? No? Do I suspect that Duchess Katherine might be hoping to be rewarded for retaking Castile... that would be quite a reward."

"No....no" Edward replied nervously upon the mention of a wife, "Katherine's already married... she's a Duchess after all, not a Dowager. There is still a Duke."

"Oh. I bet you are both very disappointed." Ferdinand replied in his usual annoying and sarcastic tone.

"These things don't concern you... can we change the subject" Edward snapped.

"Okay.. Okay." Ferdinand reasoned, "how about we talk about my cell... it's not exactly luxurious. Your's on the other hand... just look at what they have me wearing." Ferdinand was dressed in a simple loose black shirt and trousers that was commonly given to prisoners, it was a sign of Ferdinand's differing status as a prisoner here, than as a prisoner in Jaca.

"I did request that you be treated well" Edward pointed out.

"Oh!.. I dread to think what my conditions would be like if you hadn't" he chuckled.

"Very funny" Edward replied, he smiled but wasn't quite as amused by it as Ferdinand was. Edward was now wishing that he'd kept Ferdinand waiting and changed first, with every passing minuet the uniform was getting more uncomfortable, if it wasn't bad enough that the vest was constraining him, the trouser buckle was only done up by the skin of it's teeth, and actually almost hurt when he was seated.

1553322111121111111212111112122112211211.content:
"Are you okay" Ferdinand asked Edward, as he noticed him fiddling impatiently with his trousers, and stand up.

"Yep.. yep, i'm fine." Edward lied, he was urgently trying to pull them up further to make himself comfortable.

"You don't look fine" Ferdinand retorted, "and I was gonna say.. nice uniform."

The concern and complement sounded genuine, though Edward could never be sure when the words came from Ferdinand,
"I..I'm fine now. And thanks.", Edward replied, he went to sat down and *snap*, his trouser cord had snapped. The noise was loud enough that Ferdinand would have had to have been out of the room not to here it. Ferdinand rose from the corner of Edwards bed and approached Edward and subtly encouraged him to stand up, as he did so Edward's trousers fell a few inches down his legs.

"I said that everything wasn't fine" Ferdinand joked, "those trousers don't seem to be your size"

"Yeah... I guess not" Edward replied.

"Why did you ever put them on" Ferdinand asked curiously, looking at the gab between the two sides of the fastening, "they look far too small for you... they must have been quite a squeeze"

"Yeah..." was all Edward could say in reply as he tried to pull the trousers back up.

"Well take them off" Ferdinand said in a supremely casual voice, "I bet your vest and jerkin, or what not, are not your size also"

Ferdinand was right, but Edward was reluctant to undress and further embarrass himself in front of a boy he had such a crush on, as stupid and forbidden as it may be. Especially if the vest then ripped.

"Don't be shy my pale prince" Ferdinand said affectionately, "We have laid together before after all."
He went around the front of Edward and started unbuckling his shirt, after a couple of seconds Edward slipped off his trousers and then took over, and Ferdinand backed away and perched once again on Edward's bed.

Once the vest was completely unbuckled, Edward breathed a huge sigh of relief. The shirt was not at all tight, and for the first time in hours Edward felt comfortable.

"You look better now" Ferdinand pointed out, "fortunately for me these prison rags are far too loose to be so tight"
Without a moments further thought, Ferdinand just pulled his shirt off and showed his sexy torso.

"Nothing would be tight on you" Edward said, somewhat mesmerized by the sexy Castilian prince sat in front of him.

"This is still Castile, and it's a fine night." Ferdinand said, implying that Edward should remove the shirt.

Once again Edward was reluctant, he would then be more undressed than Ferdinand... and this ship was far less private than the tower in Jaca. Ferdinand's persistent nudging however convinced him and he slowly unbuttoned his shirt, revealing his soft, pale and untoned torso.

Ferdinand stood up and placed his hands around Edwards belly and kissed him, "I'll be shocked if you tell me that you hadn't guessed the real reason I asked for your presence?"

"I kinda had" Edward replied honestly, returning the kiss and placing his hands around Ferdinand's back.

After a minuet or so of kissing the two both lay upright next to each other on Edward's bed, Edward looked at Ferdinand's body... even sat like that he could barely see any flab on Ferdinand's body. Edward was still amazed by it.

1553322111121111111212111112122112211211.content:
"Your looking chubbier than when I last saw you my gorgeous prince... have you put on weight" Ferdinand asked.

It was amazing how Ferdinand could ask such a personal question so directly, yet so irresistibly. Never the less Edward was still surprised, "what?"

"You looked pudgy when I last saw you.. since then you look... softer" Ferdinand explained, he rubbed Edward's soft stomach lovingly to illustrate.

Edward thought back to what he'd eaten since, at first he thought nothing much really. But then he remembered the meal he'd had earlier, he'd had the same soft of thing every day since he last saw Ferdinand, more actually... and that was only dinner, there was breakfast and lunch in addition to that. Thinking carefully about it, it stands to reason he's going to gain weight after eating that much crap. Obviously he'd never been particularly slender, he'd always had a stomach that was on the soft side, but he never really gave credence to the idea of a king gaining weight, especially one as young as he was.

Ferdinand chuckled, and kissed Edward caringly next to his lips, "the silence says you agree"

"I suppose I have eaten allot of crap of late." Edward admitted.

"You must have gained a good few pounds since I last saw you" Ferdinand said, he couldn't resist but fondele Edwards belly. He had small rolls, which were protruding over his waist, especially the front but also the sides. Ferdinand couldn't help but find it incredibly sexy.

"Perhaps a few, when I was last weighed I was about 10 stone 4... 144 pounds" Edward replied. "That was quite a while ago though. I've never been particularly skinny. Always had a stubborn bit of flab on my belly that would never go anywhere."

"I use to know what that was like" Ferdinand reminisced. "I use to be quite chubby.. never quite quite as pudgy as you though"

"I'd heard" Edward replied. As embarrassing as the conversation was, as it focused on his fat stomach, Edward was enjoying about their respective bodies with Ferdinand. He didn't find it as awkward as he thought he might.

info.description:
The story of the weight gain of Princes and other aristocratic males.

Rules
* Only males characters can gain;
* No sudden and unatural gains - meaning no magic, weight gain formulae etc;
* More than one person may gain per story - other primary characters for example, but mainly keep to the chosen primary character;
* No vore.
* Sex allowed - male and female, only don't be too explicit.

 

Story information:


In a Renaissance style era: The three Kingdoms stand on the precipice of war as a tenuous peace fragments. Past wars have deprived some nations their Kings, and the younger generation must step forward and take the reigns of power.

Main three Kingdoms:

Mercia – Mercia is the second largest of the three major kingdoms, it’s massive coast line has allowed it to develop it’s navy into the largest and most powerful in the known world. To the east Mercia boarders it’s bitter rival, Aquitaine. (Loosely based on England)

Castile – Castile is the smallest and furthest south of the three major kingdoms. It has a considerably warmer climate than its two rival powers, as such it’s population have tanned olive skin rather than the pale skin found in Mercia and Aquitaine further north. (Loosely based on Spain)

Aquitaine – Aquitaine is the largest, and arguably the most powerful of the three major kingdoms. Aquitaine shares its western border with Mercia, it’s oldest rival, and it’s southern border with Castile. (Loosely based on France)

Other (minor) kingdoms

Empire of Ankara - The Empire of Ankara lies to the far east, beyond the Antiqua peninsular, and is often seen as almost alien by the western Kingdoms. It has a warm climate, and is famous for it's succession conflicts. It is ruled by a Grand Vizier. (Loosely based on Turkey)

Republic of Siècle - The Kingdom of Siècle of the Antiqua peninsular encompasses the central regions of what was the Antiqua Imperium. Plagued by instability caused by numerous power grabs, Siècle has lost the wealth and majesty it once possessed. Currently ruled by the Signoria, a council of the nobility, which is headed by the Gonfaloniere. By all intents and purposes Siècle is a hereditary monarchy. (loosely based on the Kingdom of Sicily or Naples)

Principality of Florentine - Florentine is a city state on the Antiqua peninsular and borders Siècle. With a population comparable only to the capital cities of Aquitaine or Mercia, Florentine posses little military muscle. The city state is however is incredibly wealthy, which has given it prime diplomatic seats at the great courts despite it's size. (based of Italian city states, incl Florence and Venice)

Kingdom of Ruscovia - Ruscovia is located far to the northwest of Mercia, Aquitaine, and Castile, a grand waste locked in ice ten months out of the year. (loosely based on Russia)
[credit to Mizu for this creation]

Archduchy of Saxony - Saxony is an Archduchy to the east of Aquitaine. Originally a large city state, Saxony has rapidly expanded over the past couple of centuries to become a power that Aquitaine no longer ignores. Saxony is famed for not only for it's professionalism, but for it's aggression and militarism. (loosely based on Austria and Prussia)

Arcadia - Arcadia is a nation east of the Arcadian peninsular. Arcadia prides it's self on being the birth of civilisation and maintains a number of traditions relating to governance dating back Millenia, despite being only formed in it's current form 3 century's previous. Arcadia is ruled in part by it's Ecclesia, a democratic assembly of notables, and it's elected Archon, who in regards to power and dynastic succession makes him a de'facto monarch.

Grand Principality of Mainz - Mainz is a wealthy nation north of Saxony, that was invaded two years ago and now constitutes a directly ruled province of the Archduchy. It's de juri Grand Prince retains his title, and resides a virtual prisoner in the Saxon capital. The former ruling dynasty is a cadet branch of the Yorks of Mercia.

---- Free choices - keep in mind the era, and that it can only be minor relative to the three major kingdoms (above).

Monarchs

Queen Mary of Mercia - Recently acceded to the throne; eldest child of deceased king. Ambitious, cunning and ruthless she took the throne when her father died as her unambitious younger brother was bellow 18 - avoiding a recency. Able to secure peace in her borders, Mary consider seen the waning power of Aquitaine and it's weak king as an opportunity to increase the power of Mercia - either through diplomacy, marriage or war.

King Philip of Castile - An elderly king who is on his sick bed. Those around him vie for more power and ultimately, the throne.

King Laurence of Aquitaine - Acceded the thorone as an infant, Laurance has had a recency in the form of his privy council ruling Aquitaine for him until he came of age, he know must compete with them was war looms with Mercia it's strong and power hungry Queen.

 

Five years later timeline information.


Note: this side-timeline is not compulsory unless the lead character's profile clearly says so.

Five years has passed since peace, since the death of King Philip of Castile. As rival successors fought over the throne and pulled Castile into the abyss of civil war, the powerful kingdoms to the north saw their opportunity and made their moves. Aquitaine sent armies across their souther boarder and overwhelmed the divided and weakened Castileans, capturing over half of the vast nation in less than a month. With the majority of the Castilian army fighting in the northern regions of the country, a vast Mercian battle fleet landed a substantial invasion force in the south, which succeeded in capturing the southern most portion of Castile, with it the capital city Jaca, with little resistance.

After restoring order to north and south Castile, Aquitaine and Mercia, respectively, pressed on with their attempts to capture the entire country. Both appointed puppet kings, and sought to cut off external trade for the other. Aquitaine stationed soldiers across the border while Mercia blockaded all major northern ports, east and west. Thus began the uneasy stalemate, as everyone wondered who would make the next move.
